title: Great roller
text: This roller is amazing. I wasn’t sure if I liked the color schemes but the function out performed its colors. Definitely a must have. Lulu, would you offer more colors for this roller?

title: Better than your average roller
text: It hurts like a you know what but the results are what I need after training. Props to lulu for making this product a 2 in 1. I really like that there are two types of rollers available depending on my self-torture needs. I love the design. It doesn't have any odor and it's easy to store. I hope lulu continues making these types of products. Can you please make elastic some exercise bands with motivational messages? Also, if this is painful for you, maybe lulu should consider making a smoother roller too.

title: Very Good Foam Roller
text: I have a love/hate relationship with this thing! I love it because it does it's job and helps roll out sore muscles and I hate it because those same sore muscles are screaming while I do it! This is a great roller because the outer layer gets deep and the inner roller gets even deeper. I do wish you could use the outer portion without the inner portion in it, but it's very easy to slide in and out! The grooves get a deeper stretch into the muscle much better than a flat roller does. Overall, I would recommend this and I've even gotten other people in my gym to use who have really liked it as well!

title: Decent Roller
text: This roller is a fairly decent one. Its a sweet deal, you get two for the price of one! The outer roller is softer and can't be used without the inner roller inside. The inner roller is firm and works wonders on the back. The outer roller is ridged and works wonderfully as well. All in all its a decent roller. I only have given it a lower rating because the outer portion can't be used without the inside part.

title: Comfy Shirt
text: I was pretty stoked having my first lululemon shirt, and this shirt has been the most durable during sweaty workouts at SoulCycle. I was really impressed with the quality of the shirt I bought another one. Wish these shirts come in long-sleeve versions.

title: Shirt shrunk immeasurably
text: The metal vent tech short sleeve was a perfect fit for me when I first got it, but it shrunk almost two fold after it was put in the wash. I am now unable to wear it, and I cannot return it since I took off the tags.
response:
Hey Jkim,

Thanks for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I'm sorry to hear your Metal Vent Tech Short Sleeve has shrunk. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat Soon!

title: Color
text: ordered a Marina colored shirt which showed up as more of a teal/green on the website. received the shirt only to find out it is dark blue. somewhat disappointed because I also ordered a navy shirt, but quality and comfort is great.
response:
Hey jdhockey,
I'm bummed to hear that you've received something in a deceiving colour -- we'd love to help you out! Please reach out to our GEC at 1.877.263.9300 and one of our educators will be able to help you out -- we hope to hear from you soon!

title: Shirt doesn't last long
text: I initially liked this shirt as it is very comfortable and fits extremely well. It's fitted but not tight and loose enough to work out in without feeling constricted. However, after only wearing this shirt a handful of times, the shirt is already pilling in many areas. Considering that I've never deviated from the washing directions provided by Lululemon, I must conclude that the quality of the material isn't very good. It's very disappointing since these shirts are expensive and are supposed to be of high quality.
response:
Hey SoleCatalyst,

We're sorry to read of your recent experience and would love to discuss this further. Please be sure to give us a call at our Guest Education Centre on 1.877.263.9300 or you can always start a Live Chat with us on our website. We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Best fitting shirt I own
text: Love these shirts.

title: My Review
text: Excellent comfort, fit and style!

title: Perfect fit
text: I bought this for my boyfriend and he absolutely loves it! He wears it all the time. The fit is accurate and it looks even better in person! I definitely recommend.

title: favorite casual tee
text: I'll never wear cotton again.

title: Best workout shirt
text: I bought this shirt and couldn't be happier. I have worn this to Yoga, Basketball, and Running. It works great, I love the feel, and plan on purchasing a few more. The fit is great too.

title: Comfortable workout shorts
text: These shorts are light and comfortable. They fit well around the waist and are snug enough when you run in them. The pockets are great for keeping your key in or phone when needed.

title: In love with the fabric.
text: Fabric is incredibly soft and fit as expected. The only disappointing thing is that the logo of the t-shirt I received is not in the same position nor shape as the one showed on the photo of the DEEP ROUGE item. :(

title: Faltering Construction
text: The material and design of the shirt are great and I've been using them for years. They move with your body and wick sweat well, without sticking. Over my past couple of purchases I have noticed that the quality isn't as high as it once was. On a couple of my shirts the neck has stretched out and seams are coming undone after only a couple weeks of use, which is disappointing.
response:
Dear run98,

Thanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. We stand behind the quality of our product, and we want to ensure that you're in gear that is performing well for you. I hear that this is not the case and would like to work with you to create a resolution. We have sent you an email outlining a few options.

title: Easy classy
text: A T-shirt that looks nice enough for eh office over the usual Hanes.

title: Unusual Experience
text: I love Lululemon and wear it almost every day, however the red metal vent tech short sleeve has wear and tear from washing it after each workout. It is not like any other Lululemon Shirt I have... I am not sure why this one is different. Overall, this particular shirt seems very poor quality to me. Shirt is relatively new, yet is already falling apart. I am disappointed.
response:
Hi cg22ku,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We are sorry to hear that your Metal Vent Tech Short Sleeve is not performing for you, and we would love to help. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!

title: bad quality

We're sorry to read of your recent experience and would love to discuss this further. Please be sure to give us a call at our Guest Education Centre on 1.877.263.9300 or you can always start a Live Chat with us on our website. We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Inconsistent Sizing
text: I've bought several metal vent short sleeved shirts over the past few years and one thing i've noticed is that they're sizing is too inconsistent. I have shirts that fit me like a small when they're actually mediums and mediums that sometimes fit perfectly or slightly too large. I used to buy these shirts online, but now i must try them on in-stores. The sizing is my only complaint. The quality is great, its perfect for working out, and I always get compliments on my shirts.

title: Own multiple of these...
text: I own a few of these shirts. I love the silverescent material and feel of the shirts, however one of the shirts did start getting the bacon neck after a few wears and washes. Not sure if i received a defective shirt or this is common as my other one's have not experienced this yet. I also wash as Lululemon recommends and hang dry their clothes but this one shirt didn't quite hold up like I'm used to of Lululemon men's products.
response:
Hi ElCaptain24,
Thanks for taking the time to share this feedback. It's not good to hear that one of your shirts has stretched out in the neck. I've sent an email your way with some solutions so we can help you out on this one! Chat soon.

title: Unbelievable
text: These shirts are simply amazing. Lightweight, yet sturdy and breathable material for the best workout gear and casual wear. I do prefer the heavier material used in the Metal Vent Tech shirts as opposed to the light-weight material in the Surge shirts. The only thing I would like to see Lululemon do with these shirts is offer a wider range of colors, specifically brighter colors. These shirts have the potential to really stand out! Keep doing what you are doing Lulu!

title: Disappointed
text: I love lulu lemon. It is my main apparel for working out. That being said, I was extremely disappointed with this specific shirt. I purchased the metal tech vent sleeve shirt roughly 1 year ago and am already noticing the color wash out as well as the wrinkly neck top I get after washing. This is simply not what I signed up for and lulu quaility has been better in the past. Truly disappointed in my purchase.
response:
Hey Wrinkly,

Thanks for taking the time to pass along some feedback on the Metal Vent Tech Short Sleeve. I'm sorry to hear about the fading and wrinkling on your short sleeve. Keep an eye out for an email headed your way. Chat soon!

title: My White Tops Bled
text: I have several of the Metal Vent Tech tops, most are 2014 vintage, and I absolutely love them and was going to buy more. However, I went for 2 long runs this weekend (it was extremely hot and humid in Atlanta) and wore my white tops, one Small, the other Medium), and I laundered them as usual in cold water with other whites, but inexplicably both tops bled - the off-white color from the little waves in the fabric bled into the pure white. Not sure why that happened?
response:
Hey jmzatl,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We want your gear to support your sweatiest pursuits and it sounds like your Metal Vent Tech Short Sleeve isn’t up to the task. We’d love to turn this around and get you into gear that works for you. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way!

not_like: size grows about 2 sizes when wet
title: Is this actually for exercise?
text: I have recently gotten into hot yoga and after struggling with regular gym shorts that go beyond the knee, it was time to upgrade. I purchased several of these shirts to go with my new shorts. I found it interesting that these shirts grew about 8" in length by the end of a 1 hour class and began to hang like a draped tent. I went into my local store and the manager told me I couldn't return them unless they were defective (I would call this defective). This brings me to the question; is Lululemon clothing simply clothing and not actually supposed to be used while exercising? Very disappointed.
response:
Hey thebomba,

Thank you for taking the time to review the Metal Vent Tech Short Sleeve. We want you to know, feedback is at the heart of everything we do and we'd love to make this experience right for you. Please be on the lookout for an email headed your way. It'll detail the next steps to take to resolve this.

ageRange: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.
title: Inconsistant Sizing

not_like: not as nice as the older shirts
title: Go to workout shirt
text: I own a little over a half dozen of these shirts and have been happy with all of them. They fit well overall. (always try it on because I have noticed different fits with different colors) They are good at wicking sweat, surprisingly don't smell even after a long workout, and overall look really nice. So why only a 4 star? Well my first shirt was purchased a little over 4 years ago and that fit and quality is far beyond the current design. While I still like the new shirts the 4 year old one looks newer than the one i bought a few months ago. Still these are my favorite workout shirts I have even owned.

title: Disappointing
text: I am a huge fan of the Metal Vent line and have 7 variations. On a surprisingly warm day I stopped in to the store to see if I could find a short sleeved shirt to change in to. Surprisingly I found a metal vent in my size and a color I didn't have so I snatched it up and wore it immediately. After cooling off for a few minutes I found myself disappointed in the fit. This new version (with all the holes) fits a lot looser than all of my other shirts and now sits in the back of my closet unworn since that day. UnfortunatelyI have never regretted a clothing purchase as much as this one and will now be a lot more careful when shopping.

title: Stretched out after only one wash
text: I really had high hopes for this shirt. Super comfortable and fit perfectly the first few times I wore it. After I washed (as instructed) and air dried the shirt ONE TIME, it stretched out to the point that it's unwearable because of how baggy it fits me now. Super disappointed!

Please be sure to give us a call at our Guest Education Centre on 1.877.263.9300 or you can always start a Live Chat with us on our website. We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Overall great, sizing doesn't seem consistent

I actually measured it and I was correct. This is very disappointing as I have purchased the vent tech in the past without any issues. not_like: new sizing, where the logo is now

title: Bring back the old logo

title: BAD LOGO

I went from buying a new shirt about once a month to not buying shirts at all. It was bad enough you needed to change the logo for the mens line but now with the logo placement it is unclear what you guys are trying to do. either display the logo proudly or take it off all together!

ageRange: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.

Now we have to drive to a store and have him try them on for either a larger size or return, if you changed more than that. Disappointed and hope the larger size works.

The green was darker and less obviously green than I hoped as well so I'm just returning and not trying another size L green right now.

title: Perfect fit for between Medium and Large
text: I'm 5'10, 160 lbs with a 40.5 inch chest. What this means is that I am perfectly in between a medium and a large size, though I'm a large with 90% of the Lulu products (Medium everywhere else).You have to be careful if you're someone like me there are certain certain of this model which vary by size, and choosing a Large will look baggy and unruly, while choosing Medium would be uncomfortably tight and awkward looking. Lulu's always been good about returns and exchanges when I have got the wrong size online however, so nbd if you make the wrong choice. Bottom line, they are my go to every day shirt, and hold up nicely over the years. I generally put my performance shirts though the works but I still have 3 year old vent techs sitting in my closet.

title: Crossfit Traveler
text: I was traveling in Europe and did not have the chance to change my shirt for several days. By the time I got home I was expecting my clothes to stink but both my ABC pants and this shirt were ready to keep traveling.

title: Deteriorating quality
text: I've been a high volume consumer of Lulu clothing for a few years now. The Metal Vent Tech t-shirts and Polos sold me on the brand. The new version seem to be an attempt to maximize profit by reducing quality. The design seems to have been simplified by removing the back side technical pattern which gave the shirt a more high end appearance and provided better breathability for workout hot spots. They also don't seem to be holding up as well either. They seem to stretch and sag a bit more as well as pilling. I sincerely hope Lulu chooses to drive loyalty and repeat sales by improving quality rather than pursue short sighted cost cutting to raise margins. I have always loved them for the innovative high quality materials and construction so please don't change that.
response:
Hey ecleland,
Thanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We hear your disappointment and will be sending an email your way to follow up and lend a helping hand.
Speak soon.

title: Great Comfortable shirt - defective stitching
text: At first I loved this shirt, very comfortable material and a great fit! The stitching then on the side just came completely unattached - just from wearing a few times (not even working out or snagging!) I understand product is sometimes defective, but it seems they didn't sew the attachments properly - it just opened wide up after a few wears. Love the shirt, but not worth the money if I can only wear it once or twice!
response:
Hey Bucknati,
Sorry to hear that your Metal Vent Tech Short Sleeve isn't holding up as expected. We stand behind the quality of our gear and have sent an email your way to discuss this further, and look into our options.

title: Love these shirts at first but disappointed in quality
text: I own many metal tech shirts from Lulu and I love how light, breathable, and stylish the shirts are. With that said, I do not know if I will be purchasing any more of these from Lulu as there is noticeable pilling on the shirt and the neckline on one of my shirts became stretched after just two washes. I now just wear it as my lounging at home shirt. Very disappointing for the price.
response:
Hi ActiveGuy,
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We'd like to turn this around and ensure your gear is providing long lasting performance for you. Since it sounds like this isn't the case, please keep an eye on your inbox so we can get to work on a solution for you.

response:
Hi lequaner,
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We'd like to turn this around and ensure your gear is providing long lasting performance for you. Since it sounds like this isn't the case, please keep an eye on your inbox so we can get to work on a solution for you.

not_like: cheap material feel, not as breathable as old ones, too thick

Thank you for taking the time to connect with us. Pulls on your short sleeve is definitely not what we like to hear, and making things right for you is our priority. Keep an eye on your inbox so we can get this fixed for you.

title: worth the price
text: Better than Nike, adidas, under armour workout shirts. I usually stayed away from any moisture wicking shirts because they tend to smell. I tried this one and i'm obsessed. A little bit pricey but I think the price is wort it. I have 5 colors now and hoping to get more when they get more colors that i like.

title: Cheaper construction and fabric
text: Waste of money. Completely different construction from the older versions -- no change in pattern in the back and sides; fabric feels unbreathable and rubbery; colors look shiny. Have four of these shirts, probably bought one season or year apart, and each passing version looks cheaper and fits worse than the previous one. So get rid of the execs and designers that are ruining the ONE item that actually justified the lululemon price tag.

title: Beware if item shipped from store
text: Bought this shirt on sale from the website. Was shipped an shirt from a store (It had the marked down sticker on the label, so I'm assuming it came from store). The issue with items from the store is that they likely have a higher chance of being damaged inadvertently. I only noticed the snag on one of the sleeves after I removed the tags and didn't think I'd be able to exchange/return, especially since it was bought on Final Sale. Next time I get an item that I think was shipped from the store and see any damage, I will try to take it in for an exchange. Just a tip.
response:
Hi MarcusL,
Thank you for sharing your experience with us. Please keep an eye on your inbox, I'll be sending through an email shortly to lend a helping hand.

title: why get rid of the old style of the vent tech with the mesh on the back
text: I really wish they still mad the old style of the metal vent techs these new ones just aren't the same. The fit, feel, and material. Feels lower quality than the older ones. Also think the newer vent techs aren't as breathable as the older ones. Shame to get rid of a good shirt to begin with.

title: Heather Black is not as pictured
text: Beware that the "heather black" color of this item is not at all as it appears in the picture. Instead, the version I received (and viewed in store) is plain gray. There is no contrast stitching in black at all and there is no "heather" appearance. It looks like a basic undershirt. Disappointing, especially amongst the backdrop of what I have noticed to be an overall reduction in quality of this particular Lulu gear from when I started purchasing it two or so years ago. Should be able to depend on the online information and pictures, especially for an item that has been in production for so long.

title: White is BAD!
text:
I personally has few of women version. I love it so much that got a white for my husband. After 2 wears for run and I handwash separately for him, it is no longer white. It looks like he wore that to rugby field. It is yellowish. Disappointing, I don' expect such quality with the price tag.
Now I am worried about White Anew Tight I just ordered.
response:
Hey HCHIN,
Yikes. This doesn't sound good. We stand behind the quality of our gear and would love to know more about your experience with this. Keep your eye out, an email is on its way.

title: Nice looking shirt; disappointing quality
text: Like others have previously stated, these are great looking shirts and extremely comfortable. However, the quality has definitely gone downhill. I have a couple of metal vent shirts that I bought 4-5 years ago and they're still like new. I recently bought a new shirt and after just three washes there are loose threads coming off the seems at the bottom of the shirt. This shirt even came with a snag in a thread on the back of the shirt, but I didn't worry about it since it was barely noticeable. However, after pulling it out of the wash and seeing loose threads after just a few wears and washes, I regret the purchase.
response:
Hey Mayor,
We recommend reaching out to the GEC as your email is not visible to us. We would be more than happy to send an email your way if you could provide us with one!

like: comfort, i love the lulu logo on the top of the shirt
title: Decent Gym Shirt
text: The shirt is very soft and comfortable. I am 5 11 and 175lb and i wear a large and it fits just how I want it. Its form fitting on the upper section of my torso and looser on the bottom section. I tried the medium but the medium seems too small as it is very form fitting to me. I wear a medium shirt for UA and its perfect for me. The lululemon large is slightly bigger than the UA medium but not by much. One downside of the shirt is the durability. I washed it twice and I already see the fabric being worn out. I wash it in delicate and air dry it but it seems to still wear a bit. Also, during workouts, the shirt does get heavy but i don;t mind it because I am in the gym to sweat. Overall, decent shirt. I hope lululemon can hopefully find a way to make it more durable.

title: New favorite gym shirt!
text: I lift at the gym 6x a week for a few hours each time. As intense as my workouts are, this fits really well and super comfortable. I previously had the core short sleeve for the gym, really didn't like it. The sleeves were long and the sizing just didn't seem right, if only I can return it! But anyways, highly recommend this shirt, looking at getting some more colors.

title: Lost Quality After a few washes
text: I love this shirt for working out and hanging out. I have it in multiple colors. However, I have noticed after only a few washes my shirts seem to lose their quality. (Yes, I followed the washing instructions.) For what I paid for the shirts I expect better quality.
response:
Hi lulurunner93,
I'm sorry to hear your Metal Vent Tech Short Sleeves are not holding up. I would love to get a better understanding why you may be experiencing this. I have sent you an email to have a further chat.

title: Unreal T-Shirt
text: These shirts are so nice. My favorite part about them is that they aren't static. After about 4-6 wears of a Nike or UA shirt that isn't 100% cotton they get staticy and stick to my body which is annoying. You don't even have to wear these shirts for workouts they're amazing for school.

like: fit, quality through many washes, do not smell
title: My Favorite Shirts
text: These are fantastic shirts!! Over the last 4 years I've had around 10 of these shirts (Long-sleeve and short-sleeve) and all of them are still in very good condition. I wear them casually and in the gym and they never smell or lose quality. I'm 6'2'' and about 190 lbs and the larges fit perfectly. These are my favorite lululemon product for their quality and lifespan.

title: The Smell!
text: The fit is incredible and I love all of the different colors, however just after 2 hours of just sitting at home doing absolutely nothing this horrendous stench comes upon me! So bad I'm embarrassed to even get near someone.....let alone even step outside my home. I would have purchased all of the colors but I can't get passed them smell.....even washing it with like colors with cold water and air drying it the smell is still there......disappointed to say the least!
response:
Hey
Thanks for taking the time to share your feedback.We would love to get a bit more information on your experience, and look into some options. An email is headed your way, so keep an eye out.

title: Same Size, Different Color, Practically a Different Shirt???
text: I purchased this shirt in black and an aqua-like color BOTH IN SIZE MEDIUM and was very surprised that the black fit very differently than the aqua. The aqua is so much looser than the black and also washes very differently. I follow the instructions to a T, and the aqua consistently comes out very very wrinkled as if it was crumbled in a ball for months whereas the black comes out perfect! Just be weary!

title: Disappointing Quality
text: This has not been my first Lululemon product and I have never had to question the quality of any products until this one. I typically run up to 30 miles a week and when I compare this product to other brands or even other Lululemon products, this product lacks character.

title: Disappointed with fit and "anti-stink"
text: I am 6 feet 190 lbs and purchased this item a couple months ago. Normally my size would be a large at any store, but not for this shirt. In the store it seemed to fit well and I spoke to the sales rep to ensure it would not shrink. They mentioned it would not shrink and all items are pre-shrunk; however, this was not the case. I washed it according to the directions and the item still shrunk. In addition, the "anti-stink" does not seem to work at all.
response:
Hey Matt00325,

title: Great Shirt for Yoga
text: After wearing this shirt a few times as I practice yoga, I have come to appreciate the design efforts from Lululemon. I practice yoga a few times a week and have other shirts from Manduka, Nike and UnderArmor and I can say without a doubt that the Lulu shirts are my favorite. This is especially true for when I sweat the most. Other people say that the shirt retains a lot of sweat and becomes heavy; yes, this is true but I have done the same activity in the same conditions with other shirts and I can say that this shirt outperforms the rest, at least the ones in my wardrobe.

title: Perfect
text: These shirts are great. I have an athletic build, so these shirts fit perfectly and allow my body to breathe. In the past, I have run into issues with small tears, but I have come to realize that you MUST wash your Lulu with other Lulu and hang dry them for best results. They cost a lot of money, therefore you gotta treat them with a lot of care. Anytime my Lulu shirts have torn, I just send them right back to the store and I get refunded. Treat these perfect fitting shirts with care, and they will love you back!

title: Sizing change???
text: Been wearing the metal vent tech shirts for years. XL has always been a perfect fit. Recently ordered the solid black shirt online in an XL and it was so tight I had to return it. Tried on the XXL and it is way too big. What happened to the sizing. Please go back to the original sizing as I now have to find another brand of workout shirt. Very disappointed!

not_like: doesn't stand up to what it's suppose to do.
title: Love the shirt, but very disappointed
text: I have purchased several of these shirts over the years. They renamed the shirt 2.0, but there was very little in the design between the shirts, but the 2.0 cost more money. I wear these shirts both long sleeve and short most days I work out. I have noticed recently in some of the short sleeve that I wear more often that they do not expel the oder from the shirt as they claim. I have followed the instructions, as always as directed. I love my Lululemon products from the shorts to my t shirt, but for what you pay for the product I would expect less issues. While I wanted to give a 5, I can't because of the level of disappointment that I have.

title: Do not wear with workouts
text: I usually buy and wear Nike Dry Knit shirts for working out and running. However, at $90, they are rather pricey. I was recommended the Metal Vent Tech, which, at $68, is a lot more affordable. So I purchased two and wore them for runs and workouts. I have to agree with another review that these are terrible when you sweat in them.

title: This season's shirt is too small
text: I ordered a new shirt for I have two other metal tech shirts that I love. I was not aware that the sizing had changed. This season's shirt fits much smaller.

location: SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA, CA, USA
title: Shirt quality in question
text: I own several other Lululemon articles of clothing where I've never encountered a problem. This shirt pilled an enormous amount after one of my laundry days. Not only does this shirt pill, the stitching is coming undone and frayed at the sleeve. For some added context on the cleaning, I wash this shirt on a delicate cycle and hang dry it. I am not pleased.
response:
Hi Kvothe,
Thanks for taking the time to share this feedback with us. We stand behind the quality of our gear, and want to make sure it's performing for you. I understand that this isn't the case, and would like to work with you to find a resolution. I’ve sent you an email to follow up. Chat with you soon.

title: Great Shirt but Sizing changed :(
text: I bought one of these shirts in a medium awhile ago and loved it, should have bought more! The shirt fit great, looked good, and felt even better! The anti-stink tech was a great bonus too. Unfortunately, recently got two more of these for Christmas and it seems they've started to change their fit/cut. I'm 6'3" so I love it when I find a brand that fits me both lengthwise without getting wide and baggy. Now the mediums have gotten shorter which would be fine but the large has gotten wider and doesn't stay with lulu's fitted look. Confusing since I'm pretty sure lulu is aiming for an athletic demographic. Hope this is a temporary change, or maybe they'll start offering 'tall' sizes in shirts like their ABC pants have!

title: Decent after 6 months, but retains sweat and becomes heavy
text: I received this shirt as a gift after getting into yoga last year. It has held up well to weekly washings and yoga 4-5 times a week. Another positive is the anti-stink technology. Unfortunately, it soaks up sweat like a sponge... so much so that I've resorted to only wearing it to lighter activity sessions. During more intense exercise, as you sweat, the shirt begins to feel incredibly heavy and sticky. Savasana becomes difficult, as I can't wait to peel myself from the fabric. Additionally, I have to be incredibly delicate while pulling it over my head as it feels like it's about to rip at any moment due to the added weight from the moisture absorption. I actually think a less stretchy fabric would benefit this model, perhaps by reducing the sweat retention.

title: Poor Fitting Shirts When Sweating - Not Made For Running or Sweating
text: As a runner and someone who works out every day, 10 - 15 miles a day and 40+ marathons. I was reluctant to try Lulu product - although my wife owns too many lulu products. My wife purchased 5 short-sleeve running shirts and if you don't actually workout in them - you will love them, but once they get sweaty, the shirt loses all integrity etc.
response:
Hey T1runner33,
Oh no. We know it's nice to have some extra breathability in your gear during your workout but not when they've expanded. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way so we can follow up and help.
Chat with you soon.

title: Pick the right color
text: I have this shirt in several different colors. I have the yellow in the short sleeve and the sleeveless. After a couple of washings they each developed shadows on the fabric that cannot be removed. Very, very disappointing with the quality of these shirts. They cannot be worn.

title: Disappointing
text: The shirt was a lot different than I expected it to be in the photos. The photos showed a black/black look and the views never showed an accurate depiction of the color. On top of that, since I received a discount through a promotion, support would not let me exchange the item. A bit smaller of a detail, but the quotes on my shirt (on the inside) were rather uninspirational as well. Disappointing for how much I spent on the shirt!

title: I only buy metal vent tech shirts!
text: Lululemon has tried making an array of new styles of shirts, but there is no need to do so! The metal vent tech shirt has been, and always will be the best shirt they make. Whether it is long sleeve or short sleeve, these shirts are amazing.

title: Best workout shirts period.
text: Ive bought them all. Nike Pro, Hylete, Rogue, UA and all the other major brands out there.

title: Everlasting
text: I have about 15 of these and I´ve sworn to this t-shirt for the last 3 years - both in and outside the gym - they are still the same shape & fit and not even a single seam has broken. Follow the washing instructions and air dry them, and they´ll last forever.

title: DONT DO IT!
text: The reason that this item is on sale is because its defective. Normally I buy medium but the vent techs on "we made too much" don't fit the same. my medium fit like a large. Try them on in the store or buy normal priced ones.

title: Purchased for my husband, now he is addicted
text: My husband never understood my obsession with lululemon until I bought him one of these. He's purchased two more on his own and one of the long sleeve. The fit is perfect, they wash well, and great sweat wicking ability. Will definitely buy him more in the future.

title: Became stretched out and didn't fit correctly
text: I own 3 of these shirts, and the two that i bought online fit perfectly for about 3 washes. After following the washing instructions directly both of the shirts became very stretched out and are almost unwearable. Very disappointed in the quality from the shirts bought online.
response:
Hi Goomba,
Thanks for checking in. Oh no! I'm sorry to hear of the retention issue you're experiencing with your shirt, and want to make things right. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way.

title: Good Fit
text: Overall the shirt fit well. Very light and a good running shirt. I wish the shirt was a little more fitted with a stretch similar to the 2012 athletic shirts.

title: Amazing shirt
text: Great shirts, I've grown my collection to 8 so far and love them all but for some reason after washing the last two that I bought for the first time the lulu sign on the back has faded almost entirely. Not sure why considering I cold wash and hang dry and this has not happened to my other ones.

like: comfortable, breathable, amazing quality in texture, perfect tennis shirt
not_like: slight tear after 1 wear/wash, price for quality in return
title: Short Lasting Shirt
text: I just got 3 Lululemon shirts as a gift from my girlfriend and one of them was the Metal Vent Tech Short Sleeve in a lightish blue color. Every shirt I got was amazing in the way it felt - it was just insane how comfortable the shirts were. The problem is that after I played tennis in my shirt once and washed the shirt I noticed that the shirt was slightly tearing in the back. It's not noticeable from a distance, but holes after 1 wear and wash? My girlfriend didn't keep the receipt, so I won't be returning the other two shirts, but I'll definitely just get them dry cleaned from now on.
response:
Hey TennisTech,
I'm sorry to hear of the holes in your shirt, what a bummer! We'd love to dig deeper into this and help turn your experience around. Please keep your eyes out for a follow-up email headed your way.

not_like: material stains, wrinkles up and hard to get out, poor construction
title: Disappointing product
text: I bought two of the Metal Vent Tech T-shirts and was very happy with them throughout my first week of use. After washing them in cold water and air-drying, I noticed stains already. It was a lighter shirt, and pit stains were very obvious after another handwash. On top, the shirt kept wrinkling up. Honestly, this was a very nice shirt until the quality of fabric showed itself in the first week. I was very excited, but it was a letdown.

title: Not Impressed
text: I was very hesitant to purchase a new product from this company after wearing Nike from years, especially at this steep price point for a shirt. However, it seemed to be very comfortable and stylish in the store so I decided to give it a try and frankly I wish I wouldn't have. The shirt started to get weird stains after just one wear without heavy sweating, not to mention the excessive wrinkling. After this experience, I do not believe I will be a returning customer.

title: can't workout in anything else
text: I bought one shirt just randomly to see what it was all about, and now I wear it more than anything else. The shirt is so comfy to work out in, and it wicks away my sweat, and thats saying a lot

like: easy-to-tear-off tag, fit, moisture wicking performance
title: Great design, fit and performance
text: First LULU purchase. Have worn Nike Dri-Fit for years and just wanted to try something new. Fabric is noticeably thicker, softer and stretchier than standard Dri-Fit, yet still light weight. Moisture wicking for one who sweats a lot like I do is as good or better than Dri-Fit, and less "clingy" when wet with perspiration. Fit is good. Length is perfect in medium (6'0'', 160 lbs).

not_like: staining, inconsistent sizing, not really feeling assured by your return policy
title: Can't wait to return. buyer be ware
text: I bought 2 of these shirts and a pair of shorts. first time purchasing Lululemon btw. After making the purchase, I read several reviews about the poor quality (i.e. inconsistent sizing, staining, etc.) of these shirts and was very hesitant to remove the tags. After just one wear of 30 minutes, and after the shirt had dried, I already started noticing the staining in random areas. I also compare the fit of both the size Large shirts and sure enough, one is at least an inch shorter than the other. I'll be returning all my items and going back to the brands that have always served me well such as Nike. Sorry Lulu, I tried.
response:
Hi Stevo1983,
Thanks for taking the time to reach out to us. We stand behind the quality of our gear and if our gear doesn't perform for you - we'd love to help you out. Give our Guest Education Centre a call at 1.877.263.9300 and they'll help work on a resolution with you.

title: Great fit
text: I have this in a few colors.. It is really a good fit. it does not make you sweat and it doesn't smell when you have a hard workout. It fits good and has kept really well after many washes. I would get more of these for sure.

title: Poor quality
text: This is the first product that I have purchased from Lululemon that I've been disappointed with. I recently ordered a couple of these and the quality if pretty poor. Like others have noted in reviews, sweat stains formed on the chest and underarms of the lighter colored shirt after just three wears and will not come out. I've followed the cleaning instructions to a tee, used high quality detergent, and air dried. No luck. Unfortunately, I had to toss the shirt because of the obvious stains. Three wears out of a $68 shirt is pretty steep.

title: Almost Amazing
text: After a great experience with my Surge 7" shorts I thought it would be appropriate to try out the great looking Metal Vent Shirt that caught my eye at the store. After trying it on it was an easy decision to buy, the only question was in how many colors! I'm 5'11, 170 lbs with a muscular build and can have a difficult time finding shirts with a good cut for my frame. Well, I needn't look any further as this shirt seemingly had it all, perfect fit and length, great feel and a stylish look that worked both for the gym and as casual wear. If I wrote this review after the first few times I wore the shirt it would have received 4 stars (out of 5). After a few washes and adhering to the care instructions I was bummed out when I noticed that the shirt started to develop bacon strips on the collar which is unacceptable (especially at the cost) and disappointing as I thought my search was over for training shirts moving forward I was totally ready to pick up one for every day of the week in a variety of colors.
response:
Hey Steels,
We're sorry to hear of your disappointment with the bacon neck you've experienced and would like to do some digging into this so we can pass along your feedback to the relevant team. An email is on the way so we can work towards a fix together.
Speak soon.

not_like: seams, neck opening, price, defective fabric, looks cheap
title: Poor craftsmanship, decent materials
text: the quality of the stitching is sub par, especially at this price point. the fabric is bunched up at the shoulders because the material was not positioned correctly before the pieces of fabric were attached. The shirt looks cheap but costs a fortune. Also, there are lines permanently embedded in the fabric due to hanging in the store for too long.
response:
Hey RealDeal,
Yikes, we're sorry to hear about what's going on with the construction of your shirt, and would love to chat more. I've sent you a follow up email so we can work this out.

title: New White Metal Vent - Yellowing Color
text: First - I love Lulu metal vent t's. I have 5+ at this point and several are 2-3 years old and going strong. However, the new white color turned yellow with my first wear and is nearly impossible to whiten in the wash even when using the "hot" setting (which I would never use on my other Lulu clothing). I wouldn't consider myself a dirty human, it seems to be something with the white fabric. Fair warning, white is not the color to choose which is a little disappointing as I was quite excited about it. I bought a black at the same time and have had no problems with it or any of my other metal vents. Unfortunately I don't think i'll be wearing my (off) white anymore.
response:
Hey DrPtr,
Thanks for reaching out. We're sorry to hear you're experiencing discolouration and definitely understand your concern. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way - we're looking forward to chatting more.

title: Great Shirt, Unbearable Smell.
text: The shirt itself is fantastic, lightweight, breathable and works well for a variety of workouts. The only issue is the smell. The shirt is billed as odor resistant and while this is true for the first month or so, I am not able to get the smell out of this shirt no matter how hard I try. I have followed the wash instructions closely to no avail. Unfortunately, I will have to throw this shirt out as my wife has banned it from the house as a result of the smell. Unfortunate!

title: Poor Quality
text: I really loved this shirt when bought it and have several of them. I got a light blue colored one recently and wear it to work out in. I sweat some when I work out and after only a few wears sweat stains formed on the chest and made the shirt unwearable. I followed every instruction for caring for the product before the issue and tried every suggestion to get it out, but the stain remains. When I spoke with customer service they suggested that I must have spilled something on it (which I didn't) and basically told me that it was my fault. I've never had this happen with any other shirt this badly after so few wears. Way too much money to pay for a shirt that I can only wear a few times. I love how comfortable it is, but I am very disappointed with this shirt and the customer service I received.
response:
Hello there mg21,
Thank you for reaching out to us. I'm sorry to hear of your experience with the stains on your shirt. I'd like to chat further with you about this, so watch for an email that will outline the next steps.

title: Inconsistent Sizing
text:
I purchased the Riviera Blue color and it's a beautiful color but I might return it :( This is my 3rd short sleeve metal tech and unfortunately it fits snug in the chest and shoulders and falls a bit shorter compared to my other two shirts.
I have a white one that's a little loose in the body and long in the sleeves so I roll them up once and it's looks pretty good. I also have a black one that fits near perfect in body and length so I'm a tad bit disappointed because the store in my area does not have any more riviera blue in my size and I'm sure a medium will be too big.

like: design, feel, workmanship, fit, versatility, scent (smells fresh!)
title: Best Technical Fabric Shirt
text: My first purchase ever at Lululemon was the Metal Vent Tech Shirt (old Santa Monica store on Santa Monica Boulevard). To this day, it remain my most worn and versatile shirt. I now own 12 different colors and have sized down from Large to Medium, because of improved health over time and for better fit for yang / active / vinyasa flow yoga classes.

title: Nice Shirt, But Didn't Last
text:
I really liked the look, cut, and feel of this shirt, which is why I was willing to pay a little extra for it. I can say that, while I could wear it, it was great - good fit, lightweight, sweat wicking, etc. But after wearing it (and washing it (as directed, because this is probably the most expensive shirt I own)) just four times, it started to wear/pile in two spots on the front of the shirt. :-(

title: Awesome shirt, but has some quality issues
text: I have bought several of these shirts for my husband and have noticed piling on almost every shirt (chest area). We are careful when washing (inside-out on gentle cycle) and always air dry. He loves the comfort of them and the overall lulu brand, but am surprised of the piling issues for the cost.
response:
Hi KIMMYV,
we're sorry to hear your husband is experiencing pilling with his Metal Vent Tech Short Sleeve. We would love to ask you a few questions to better understand why he may be experiencing this. We have sent you an email to have a further chat.

title: Great shirt if not for quality issues
text:
Pros: Love the design, fit and feel of the shirt. Extremely comfortable and breathable.
Cons: Poor quality for the price point. Experienced multiple holes, loose threads and pilling in the first few months of normal (not even strenuous) wear even when following all washing instructions.
response:
Hey MichaelB,
Thanks for reaching out to share that you're experiencing holes, loose threads and pilling with your Metal Vent Tech Short Sleeve. Reach out to our GEC at 1.877.263.9300 so we can continue this conversation and dig into why this may be happening.
Speak soon.

title: Great shirt-quality is questionable
text: I recently bought this shirt and wore it for a few workouts. I washed it after my workouts and noticed it was snagged from the wash. Over time this snag has become a hole in the mesh portion of the shirt. Im really disappointed because I loved the shirt for working out but the quality and price don't match up to what they should be. Paying 70 dollars for a workout shirt one would hope it would last longer then a couple weeks.
response:
Hey Griff,
We're sorry to hear you've experienced a snag which has turned into a hole in your Metal Vent Tech Short Sleeve. Keep an eye out for an email headed your way so we can follow up and chat about some solutions.
Speak soon.

title: Quality Issues... this shirt doesn't have the lifespan you would expect!
text: I bought one of these for my boyfriend at Christmas this year and was saddened to hear that there is now a hole in the back from regular wear. Bummer. I love lululemon gear and wear more than my fair share so it is always disappointing to hear that an item isn't as well made as it should be given the price point.
response:
Hey RowRunRest,
That's a big thumbs down from us. We definitely understand your disappointment and have sent an email your way so we can chat further about the hole your boyfriend is experiencing in his Metal Vent Tech Short Sleeve.
Speak soon.

not_like: stains from plain sweat horribly and permanently, awkward sizing. the baggiest "medium" ever
title: Sweat stains seem permanent after a single use
text: I really liked this shirt when I first saw it. I sweat a bit when I'm exercising, but the sweat stains that appeared on this shirt during my first workout in it are impossible to get out and are really really really visibly obvious. I tried every trick I could look up online and two different stain remover products that have worked flawlessly on my white undershirts and dress shirts and every other workout shirt I've owned and I just can't get them out of this one after a single use. I've never had this happen with any other brand and I really don't know what to do, the thing's super comfortable but unwearable unless I can show up to the gym already sweating like a pig to camouflage it I guess. Far too expensive for a one-use product. Excitement shattered.
response:
Hi there Duffin,
I'm sorry to hear of your experience with the staining on your shirt. I can completely understand why you're disappointed by this. We fully stand behind the quality of our gear, so I'd suggest reaching out to our GEC - 1.877.263.9300. They'll be able to speak further to you about a resolution option.

title: Terrible
text: I"m an avid runner, always wear dry fit gear from Nike or Under armour but my wife bought me 3 of these shirts as a gift in different colors. After 2 runs and washes they each fell apart to the point that I had to just throw them away. For the price I was shocked by how poor the durability was. Told my wife to stick to the good brands going forwards for gift ideas . Stay away.
response:
Hey willnotlast1week,
We would like to do some digging into your Metal Vent Tech Short Sleeve and the construction issues you're experiencing. Keep an eye out for an email headed your way.
Chat soon.

title: A bit inconsistent
text: Shirts have generally been pretty good - comfortable for the most part, but have noticed a few things that have been a bit of a disappointment.
response:
Hey chb456,
Thanks for sharing your feedback on your Metal Vent Tech Short Sleeve. An email is headed your way so we can follow up and help with the pilling you're experiencing.
Speak soon.

title: Disappointing
text: I have worn athletic shirts from Nike and Under Armour for years and have never been dissatisfied. Recently, I tried some of the lululemon shirts due to their breathability and style. I was willing to pay more than usual for these shirts because I had heard great things. These shirts pill beyond belief. It is a very poor reflection of Lululemon and i believe it is atypical of what they hope to achieve. Lululemon prides itself on quality, however, my experience proves contrary. However, I have many pairs of the shorts and pants and have never had issues with them. I would hope that given how much I paid for the shirts that they would last longer and not pill.
response:
Hi athlete10,
Thanks for taking the time to share this feedback with us. We stand behind the quality of our gear, and want to make sure it's performing for you. I understand that this isn't the case, and would like to work with you to find a resolution. I’ve sent you an email to follow up. Chat with you soon.

like: pockets!!!, lining, doesn't stick to you when sweaty
not_like: a little snug around the thigh
title: Magical
text: Love them! They are comfortable and look amazing. The best part is all the pockets that seem to appear out of nowhere (I'm still finding new ones) that hold your essentials. And best of all, once you drop something in the pocket, it is completely invisible, like something from a Harry Potter book. Amazing considering these shorts cover less than the average pair of boxers!

title: Would order again
text: I wish they had pockets on the side and I’m not a fan of the mesh under them so i cut it out but the shorts themselves are awesome i love the length and the fabric and fit

title: Not great for warm weather running
text: After receiving these in the mail and trying them on I wasn’t impressed by the addition of an inner “compression” type fitted liner. These shorts would be way to hot and snug for warm weather running.
response:
Hi Nick98j,

Thanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear, and we’d like to work with you towards a fix. We'll be following up via email to discuss this further. Speak soon!

title: Go Tos
text: Great for lounging or exercising, love the freedom of the 4” inseam as well as the comfort of the liner. Have all three colors and rotate through them routinely.

not_like: oom liners, not enough colour options
title: OOM liners not a fan
text: For the past 7 years, I’ve thoroughly enjoyed your Surge Shorts 5”, w/ the regular brief liners. I have 10 pairs of this, which I will cherish forever. They're great for bikram yoga. Then you did a complete overhaul about 2 years ago (very few options for the liners & a lot of colour options for the linerless). This April/May 2018, another drastic overhaul happened. It now comes in the 4”, 6”, but w/ the OOM liners. Some may enjoy the new updated surge shorts but I am not a big fan. This just gets in the way during my bikram classes. I do not understand why you have to change things that are not broken. I may have to venture on other brands as there’s no other 4” or 5” shorts you have with the regular liners anymore. An associate suggested purchasing other shorts w/ the liners I want & just have it tailored (as that's free) so it'll be the same length. It's so much of a hassle. I have always loved the lululemon brand. Now, however, I am greatly disappointed you have nothing to offer me anymore.
response:
Hey Roland,

Thanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. We want your gear to support your sweatiest pursuits, but it sounds this isn’t the case for you. We'd love to chat with you further to gather more information from you and work towards a resolution. We'll be reaching out via email, so keep your eyes peeled on your inbox.

title: Nice quality shorts, but snug and retains smell
text: These are good shorts, but if you have even a medium size butt and thighs from lifting, then they're gonna feel really snug. Sizing up offers kind of a weird dimensions, but might work.
response:
Hey jsonnnnnnsf,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. That doesn't sound like a good experience at all! Give us a call at the Guest Education Centre (GEC) at 1.877.263.9300, or start a chat with us on our website. We look forward to speaking with you soon!

title: Awesome update
text: These shorts are perfect - the new trunk style liner is so much more comfortable than the old style. Material (both shorts and liner) feel great. Added bonus: these don't bunch up!

title: Love the fit and style!
text: I've always loved the look and style of lululemon shorts, but haven't connected with them as a runner, but this is the first pair that I've found that doesn't bunch while running. I've purchased 3 pairs total and would recommend them to anyone looking to update their running attire.

title: Best enhancement
text: The Surge shorts are my favorite running shorts of all time. I run 70-100 miles/week. I prefer the shorter length and the 4" hit perfectly. The OOM trunk liner is the best and most innovative enhancement. It doesn't ride up at all. The Surge are bomb-proof and I have put countless miles on my first pair with literally no indication of excessive wear in the crotch part of liner, which usually breaks down in other shorts. This is my go-to. and the phone pocket is the only way i'll run with my phone, no bounce and flush to the leg. great job Lulu!!

title: Great Shorts
text: Perfect length and great materials. The only annoying thing is the lack of pockets on the sides. There's a small pocket at the back for cards and small things but there is no where to put my phone so I'm always having to hold it if I'm not wearing a jacket.

title: The Happy Medium
text: Ideal compression and doesn't ride up the thighs in stride. 4" length is perfect for speed work & long enough to wear casually after the workout. Great fit and flexibility

title: Fantastic shorts
text: These shorts r super comfy and perfect for doing basically anything in.

title: Nothing SHORT of awesome
text: Great fit and material. I love the way they feel.

title: great!
text: great shorts all around

title: Prefer the old liner
text: Just like the last year model, minus the liner. I agree with most every review of these in that the liner rides A LOT, so much to where I went up in size so it’s not as bad.

title: Just Not The Same...
text: I'm the ultimate fan of LULU shorts but its seems like the quality of shorts are not what they once were. And they got rid of the LUX Liner. The updated THE shorts are a tad bit thinner and lighter, and the liner is absolutely awful. They ride up within minutes of walking, it's like wearing a tight bikini brief. Also, they are NOT sweat resistant in the least bit, compared to the original THE shorts with the LUX liner. My shorts were totally drenched after a workout. Please bring back the LUX Liner, by far the best shorts ever made!
response:
Hey Iron32,

Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We're sorry that the quality of your T.H.E. Short 9" is not what you expected and we would love to make this right for you. Give us a call at our Guest Education Centre (1.877.263.9300) or jump on Live Chat to speak directly with an educator. We look forward to speaking with you soon!

title: The liner is really disappointing
text: I have a couple pairs for T.H.E. Short but linerless, so I thought I'd try out the one with liners since those were new and the only ones in stock. Just wore them for the first time today and I can't stand the liner, it rides up so easily making the short extremely uncomfortable to wear which is really disappointing because now I can't even return them since they have been worn. Bought these in Hawaii and they have a specific Hawaii graphic so these were my souvenir too, so just really disappointed in these overall.
response:
Hi mbkimura,

We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us. We hear what a frustrating experience this must be and have sent an email your way so we can do some digging into this. Best wishes!

title: Best Shorts Out There
text: Very nice pair of shorts. Very comfortable and the pocket on the right hip allows me to carry my phone with me and it is not bulky feeling in my pocket.

title: Terrible Liner
text:
I own a couple pairs of the original THE Shorts with Luxtreme liner and loved them. Then i bought a pair of these in store to see how they fit and feel. The updated liner is so much worse, its to short and rides up and needs constant adjusting.
They also removed the phone pocket on the right side which was very annoying to me, but since the liner is so short I dont use the pocket anymore as I dont want to flash people at the gym

not_like: liner length, liner rides up terribly
title: My first pair of Lululemon - not what I was hoping for.
text: I have been wanting to try a pair of Lululemon shorts for a while, I just couldn’t bring myself to spend $70 on a pair of gym shorts. I finally decided to do it and this is what I get for not reading reviews.
response:
Thanks for taking the time to share your thoughts on T.H.E. Short 9" *Updated.
I'm sorry to hear of the rising liner that you're experiencing in your shorts and can understand why you're not pleased. We hear what a frustrating experience this must be and have sent an email your way so we can do some digging into this.

not_like: shorter liner, pouch, left-hand only phone pocket, higher phone pocket
title: Good fabric update, liner too short, other updates don't make sense
text: The original THE shorts were game-changers for my running and working out, and I love them. Like many other reviewers, I was disappointed when I picked up a pair of the updated THEs, primarily because the liner is too short and creeps a lot during running/working out. Here is a summary of the other differences I noticed in the updated version:
response:
Hey LarryT,

Thanks for taking the time to pass along some feedback on the T.H.E. Short 9" *Updated. I'm sorry to hear the new liner updates and length aren't working out for you. Keep an eye out for an email headed your way. Chat soon!

title: I really tried to like the updated short . . . .
text:
I have over a dozen T.H.E. shorts with the luxtreme liner, and could not be happier with their fit and comfort. However, the new updated short is an extreme disappointment.
The liner is too tight, too small, and too short. I am a fit yogi with 33" waist wearing a size large in these shorts (normally wear medium), and the liner is constantly moving and creeping up where it needs to be adjusted constantly and continuously during my yoga practice. I tried wearing them a few times to practice to see if I could get used to them, but it is a losing proposition. One cannot partake in yoga with a liner that will not let you move thru your flow. The luxtreme liner is far superior, never a need to adjust during yoga, with ultimate comfort.
Other issues, the side pocket seems smaller, items do not fit comfortably like previous shorts. Also, pocket on liner is difficult to place phone into, not as secure as previous shorts.
All in all a great disappointment. I regret their purchase.
Please bring back the former shorts.
response:
Dear Naplesyogi,

Thanks for making time to leave a detailed review of your experience with T.H.E. Short 9" *Updated. We completely understand why you're disappointed with this and we'd love to help turn this around.

We stand behind the quality of our product, and we want to ensure that you're in gear that is performing well for you. I hear that this is not the case and would like to work with you to create a resolution. We want you to know, feedback is at the heart of everything we and we have submitted your specific feedback regarding the new liner to our design team.

We have sent you an email outlining a few options.

title: Liner is way too tight
text: I own about 2 pairs of pace breaker shorts, 1 with a liner which I think is very comfortable. I also own 2 pairs of T.H.E. Shorts including this one with a liner. The updated version of these shorts is way too short and tight. I thought by wearing it a couple of times I could get used to it. After 3 times of use though, I just find these unwearable because the liner is just way too uncomfortable. They are extremely tight and short. I am highly disappointed because all of my other products fit great. I bought these shorts because they were white which is a color I wanted to add to my collection, but I regret buying these.
response:
Hi secretixi,
We're sorry to read of your recent experience and would love to discuss this further. Please be sure to give us a call at our Guest Education Centre on 1.877.263.9300 or you can always start a Live Chat with us on our website. We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Not for running
text: I own over 10 pairs of Lululemon Pace Breakers. I have ran over 7 marathons and 1 ultra in them. Never had any issue besides minor slippage during a very hot race. I decided to try these after a recommendation from a local educator. The "new" liner is not good. It is too short and moves around alot. Also the seams are not as smooth as the "old" liner in the Pace Breakers and causes chafing quickly even with anti-chafe products. I will be searching out some of the "old" liner Pace Breakers to run in and will stock up because I cannot imagine running any of the races in these. I wil Lululemon would make some Men's running shorts with good gel pockets, no gimmicky shirt straps or anything. Just places to store supplies while putting in the miles.
response:
Hey fstenoughsnoopy,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. Oh no, I'm sorry to hear your gear isn't performing as expected—I can understand the disappointment. We'll be following up via email to discuss this further. Speak soon!

title: Dissapointed
text: I currently own around twenty items of Lululemon clothing. I have never been disappointed with a product until I purchased these shorts. I have multiple pairs of other versions of the short (Luxtreme liner is my favorite). But with this new updated version I am so focused on the lack of comfort of these shorts that I am distracted during my workout. I have to pull on the liner that rides up every single set, I am looking forward to the end of the workout to take these shorts off. Like i previously stated I love every other article of Lululemon clothing I own, and love the wonderful customer service.
response:
Hi ZC15,
Thanks for taking the time to share this feedback. We stand behind our gear and want to ensure that it's performing for you. I'm sorry to hear that's not the case. Keep an eye on your inbox for an email with some solutions.

title: Really Disappointed In Liner Choice For Updated Shorts
text: Please know this...I am a huge fan of lululemon. I'm a former collegiate soccer player who continues to run and stay active. I'm 5' 11'' and I'd say I'm in about the same shape I was in college almost 10 years ago. All the previous shorts I've purchased from lululemon had the LUXTREME liner, which I LOVED! However, this new liner, OOM (Out Of Mind) I am NOT a fan of. The convenience of having a built-in-liner is so that you can just grab your shorts and get going. But this liner is made of mostly mesh, it rides up my legs, and is NOT comfortable for all the athletic activities that I perform. Lululemon does offer a T.H.E. Short with a luxtreme liner, but they are all sold out. I wonder why...Anyhow, I wouldn't recommend the newly updated shorts, and I'm hoping I can return these ones.
response:
Dear NateGr,

Thanks for making time to share your experience with T.H.E. Short 9" *Updated. I completely understand why you're disappointed with this and I'd love to help turn this around.

We want you to know, feedback is at the heart of everything we do, and we'd love to make this experience right for you. We have sent you an email outlining a few options.

title: TERRIBLE Update
text: Disappointed to here that the Luxtreme lined version was no longer being made (at least not in new/seasonal colors), I was told that this was the replacement and should perform the same. This couldn't be further from the truth - the liner is more of a mesh liner instead of the compression tight that was previously used. The new mesh liner doesn't stay in place and rides up to the point of being extremely uncomfortable. If you're used to and loved the Luxtreme Liner as much as I do, do NOT buy these. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE bring the previous version back, Lulu!
response:
Hey KOPjake,

We're sorry to read of your recent experience and would love to discuss this further. Please be sure to give us a call at our Guest Education Centre on 1.877.263.9300 or you can always start a Live Chat with us on our website. We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Awesome Shorts
text:
These shorts are excellent. I like them so much that after I bought one pair I ordered two more - I wear them all the time when I'm not at work. The liner also feels terrific and isn't quite as 'heavy' as the previous iteration.
Only complaint is there aren't enough 'bright' colours ,

title: Workout Changing Shorts
text: Ive been a Lululemon guy for awhile now and these shorts are just as awesome as my last pair. They feel great, look great and work well with my lifestyle. If you're active or not, id recommend getting a pair of these shorts

like: great liner, love the waistband, perfect length
title: Be Careful On Size...otherwise, Awesome Shorts!
text: The reason I have an entire closet of Lululemon shorts, shirts and pants is due to the consistency in sizing. Until now I have always known that the size I wear will be the same fit no matter what item I selected. Not the case with these shorts. I had to go up a size to get the same fit as my other Lulu shorts. Once I exchanged them for the proper fitting shorts...game on! These are great shorts!

not_like: not tight enough, liner does not go down for enough
title: Great fit, almost a hybrid the pace breaker and luxtreme liner.
text: They are really comfortable and good for exercising in. I don't know if you would like them if you are running with a phone in your pocket as I do. The luxtreme seemed to be the best short for running in since they were tighter and seemed to be more conformed to your legs. I do like them but I wish they were not taking away the luxtreme liner as I would prefer the liner in those, but I love the lightness in the new T.H.E. shorts.

title: Awesome shirt
text: Love the feel and material of all the Metal vent tech. Sometimes the fit isn't perfect for every body style. Can be a little wide in the mid-section for an athletic fit if you size up for your shoulder's/arms. Otherwise the wear and material and second to none. These shirts last forever if you treat them as instructed by Lululemon.

title: Love
text: The fit is amazing! i see a lot of complaints about the sleeves but they're PerfeCt length any shorter and it'd be too short. Great fit! I don't have to recommend these to anyone. Any time i wear one i get compliments and almost always asked what brand it is.i also own LS Henley and i love those too just waiting on some more colors!

title: Nice colors
text: Love the newer spring colors but the sizing on these shirts are so inconsistent. For me, the chest and forearm area are way too tight. I need a little room to breathe! If those issues were resolved this would be perfect.

title: Poor Fitting
text: I had high hopes for this shirt as the short sleeve version is great. Sadly I was left disappointed as the fits was completely different. The chest is much bigger and the sleeves are extremely long. It also didn't help that the sleeves on the shirt were different lengths with one side being 2 inches longer than the other. This is not what I expected based on my experience with the other products I own as well as the price you pay for the shirt.

title: Poor quality

title: Nice fitting shirt!

title: nice style

title: Terrible colors and terrible fit
text: Lulu just isn't the company that it used to be. When ordering this shirt I thought it would be a little lighter than it appears online. All of the color options are poor and the fit, fabrics and and stitching have all been cheapened over the years.

title: Comfortable, but wont last
text: I had this shirt for a year. the fabric gets thinner and thinner eventually leading to runs and holes. I had this shirt custom screen printed for a school athletic team with my initials and team name on it. we had won state races and championships showing up in this shirt. after sending in pictures of the holes in the shirt, lulu stated I had to send it for them to actually do anything about it, but the shirt has too much sentimental value. ill just throw in the back of my closet and stay away from these shirts, you should too

title: Most comfortable shirt I've ever owned
text: I have had this shirt for three weeks now and it is the most worn shirt I have. The anti-stink definitely works too because I haven't washed it since buying it because I do not want to go a day without wearing it. Awesome shirt.

title: Not worth the price
text: So I bought my boyfriend this shirt because he had 2 already that fit perfect but when he put this one on, the sleeves were really bunched up at his wrists and almost go passed his fingertips if he pulls them over his hands. The Lululemon store we took it to said they only hem pants and the bottoms of the shirts. If I'm paying $80 for a shirt, I expect it to fit right or at least expect Lulu to hem the sleeves for me.

title: collar pilling after 2 washes

title: Great quality shirt!

not_like: color changing after a couple months., price

It's only been washed like 5 times. Like I said I want to love it, but it's kind of pricey, especially if it doesn't last.

title: Black shirt of poorer quality than other colors ?
text: I've been a huge fan of Lululemon's metal vent tech shirts for a long time. I think they are amazing workout shirts. I own four of these in long sleeves, 2 in blue, a grey and a black. The blue ones and the grey one are solid. However, it seems to me that the black one is not made of the same material as many small holes started to appear in different places. I tried in vain to return the black shirt to my local Lululemon store (I was way past the two-week return window to be honest) but the clerk refused to admit that the black metal vent tech shirts were somehow different and more delicate than the other colors... Bottom line: great shirts, but not in black.

title: Great fit but this is not a training top.
text: This long sleeve fits me perfectly: I'm 5'10 lean, 160lbs and very athletic.

title: Sleeves too long
text: First off, I just want to say how much I love this shirt. I have 2 and one fits perfect but the other one, the sleeves are about 4 inches too long. The other day, I went to the nearest Lulu store and asked if they could hem the sleeves because I have had pants hemmed there before. The manager told me they can only do pants and the bottom of the shirt and that I need to take the shirt to a seamstress ,myself, which I am perfectly capable of, but I wasn't planning on paying for it. So I'm stuck with a shirt that bunches up a lot by my wrists. I will definitely continue to shop at Lulu though because I love the quality and comfort of your clothing.

title: Great at first

I have not had any issues with quarter zips, pants, or shorts that I own. However, these shirts pick up an unbearable stench that will not subside.

title: Great Shirt
text: I love the Metal Tech line, fit is great, they look fantastic and the fabric is unmatchable by any other company. Only thing I can warn against is using deodorant with aluminum as sometimes it reacts with the silver in the shirt and causes the shirt to fade in the pits. Although that has not happened to me, I have seen it happen to many other reviewers and Lulu is fairly quick to sort things out.

not_like: my legs pinched and shorts fitting badly.
title: Pace Breaker "UPDATED" should read "RUINED"
text: I have worn these shorts for years, in yoga (teaching and practicing, strength training, hiking, and running. The inner liner never hiked up, and was comfortable. I have larger muscular quads (but not excessive;y), and whoever redesigned these made serious mistakes, as they pinch, hike up, and are generally very uncomfortable now. Why fix something that was never broken? Why not test these on guys with bigger upper legs? The new "improved" liner in the Pacebreaker and Surge are FAR tighter than the previous style, and the seam/opening are not as elastic, not to mention the sizing is off. I was a size Small before, and now the Medium is even too tight. Again, the old ones were far better, the new fit/fabric is all wrong, and Lululemon badly missed their mark on a signature item. I've spoken with other Lulu athletes and amabassadors, and everyone is feeling the same. Definitely pass on buying these, there are now better shorts with other brands.
response:
Hey swimyasa,

We’re writing to follow up on your recent review. We want your gear to support your sweatiest pursuits and it sounds like your Pace Breaker Short Linerless 7" *Updated isn’t up to the task. We’d love to turn this around and get you into gear that works for you. Look out for an email from us soon!
