I own a couple pairs of the original THE Shorts with Luxtreme liner and loved them. Then i bought a pair of these in store to see how they fit and feel. The updated liner is so much worse, its to short and rides up and needs constant adjusting.
They also removed the phone pocket on the right side which was very annoying to me, but since the liner is so short I dont use the pocket anymore as I dont want to flash people at the gym

title: I really tried to like the updated short . . . .
text:
I have over a dozen T.H.E. shorts with the luxtreme liner, and could not be happier with their fit and comfort. However, the new updated short is an extreme disappointment.
The liner is too tight, too small, and too short. I am a fit yogi with 33" waist wearing a size large in these shorts (normally wear medium), and the liner is constantly moving and creeping up where it needs to be adjusted constantly and continuously during my yoga practice. I tried wearing them a few times to practice to see if I could get used to them, but it is a losing proposition. One cannot partake in yoga with a liner that will not let you move thru your flow. The luxtreme liner is far superior, never a need to adjust during yoga, with ultimate comfort.
Other issues, the side pocket seems smaller, items do not fit comfortably like previous shorts. Also, pocket on liner is difficult to place phone into, not as secure as previous shorts.
All in all a great disappointment. I regret their purchase.
Please bring back the former shorts.
response:
Dear Naplesyogi,

Thanks for making time to leave a detailed review of your experience with T.H.E. Short 9" *Updated. We completely understand why you're disappointed with this and we'd love to help turn this around.

We stand behind the quality of our product, and we want to ensure that you're in gear that is performing well for you. I hear that this is not the case and would like to work with you to create a resolution. We want you to know, feedback is at the heart of everything we and we have submitted your specific feedback regarding the new liner to our design team.

We have sent you an email outlining a few options.

title: Liner is way too tight
text: I own about 2 pairs of pace breaker shorts, 1 with a liner which I think is very comfortable. I also own 2 pairs of T.H.E. Shorts including this one with a liner. The updated version of these shorts is way too short and tight. I thought by wearing it a couple of times I could get used to it. After 3 times of use though, I just find these unwearable because the liner is just way too uncomfortable. They are extremely tight and short. I am highly disappointed because all of my other products fit great. I bought these shorts because they were white which is a color I wanted to add to my collection, but I regret buying these.

title: Not for running
text: I own over 10 pairs of Lululemon Pace Breakers. I have ran over 7 marathons and 1 ultra in them. Never had any issue besides minor slippage during a very hot race. I decided to try these after a recommendation from a local educator. The "new" liner is not good. It is too short and moves around alot. Also the seams are not as smooth as the "old" liner in the Pace Breakers and causes chafing quickly even with anti-chafe products. I will be searching out some of the "old" liner Pace Breakers to run in and will stock up because I cannot imagine running any of the races in these. I wil Lululemon would make some Men's running shorts with good gel pockets, no gimmicky shirt straps or anything. Just places to store supplies while putting in the miles.
response:
Hey fstenoughsnoopy,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. Oh no, I'm sorry to hear your gear isn't performing as expected—I can understand the disappointment. We'll be following up via email to discuss this further. Speak soon!

title: Dissapointed
text: I currently own around twenty items of Lululemon clothing. I have never been disappointed with a product until I purchased these shorts. I have multiple pairs of other versions of the short (Luxtreme liner is my favorite). But with this new updated version I am so focused on the lack of comfort of these shorts that I am distracted during my workout. I have to pull on the liner that rides up every single set, I am looking forward to the end of the workout to take these shorts off. Like i previously stated I love every other article of Lululemon clothing I own, and love the wonderful customer service.

title: Really Disappointed In Liner Choice For Updated Shorts
text: Please know this...I am a huge fan of lululemon. I'm a former collegiate soccer player who continues to run and stay active. I'm 5' 11'' and I'd say I'm in about the same shape I was in college almost 10 years ago. All the previous shorts I've purchased from lululemon had the LUXTREME liner, which I LOVED! However, this new liner, OOM (Out Of Mind) I am NOT a fan of. The convenience of having a built-in-liner is so that you can just grab your shorts and get going. But this liner is made of mostly mesh, it rides up my legs, and is NOT comfortable for all the athletic activities that I perform. Lululemon does offer a T.H.E. Short with a luxtreme liner, but they are all sold out. I wonder why...Anyhow, I wouldn't recommend the newly updated shorts, and I'm hoping I can return these ones.
response:
Dear NateGr,

Thanks for making time to share your experience with T.H.E. Short 9" *Updated. I completely understand why you're disappointed with this and I'd love to help turn this around.

We want you to know, feedback is at the heart of everything we do, and we'd love to make this experience right for you. We have sent you an email outlining a few options.

title: TERRIBLE Update
text: Disappointed to here that the Luxtreme lined version was no longer being made (at least not in new/seasonal colors), I was told that this was the replacement and should perform the same. This couldn't be further from the truth - the liner is more of a mesh liner instead of the compression tight that was previously used. The new mesh liner doesn't stay in place and rides up to the point of being extremely uncomfortable. If you're used to and loved the Luxtreme Liner as much as I do, do NOT buy these. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE bring the previous version back, Lulu!
response:
Hey KOPjake,

We're sorry to read of your recent experience and would love to discuss this further. Please be sure to give us a call at our Guest Education Centre on 1.877.263.9300 or you can always start a Live Chat with us on our website. We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Awesome Shorts

Only complaint is there aren't enough 'bright' colours ,

The shorts' update is great and the shorts really allow for some pretty free-feeling movement while still packing the precious boys in for the run. Great moisture-whicking away from your delicates!

title: Best Running Shorts
text: These are the most comfortable running shorts I own. I've run in multiple running and sports brands and these take it by far. When you're running for an hour or three comfort makes a difference and really reduces the affects of chafing and other undesirable effects. Thanks for making these!

title: Very disappointed
text: I run 3 to 5 time a week, 30 miles on average. Run a least marathon a year, (qualified for Boston). I have been using running shorts from other brands for many years and have been very happy with them. Recently, several friends enticed to try Lululemon. So I got this running short, which was sold to me at the store as the quintessential Lululemon running short. When I asked for a running short with a zipped pocket, I was told by the store employee that Lululemon doesn't have any (which was misleading since I later found some on this website). So I got this pair of short. I still haven't used it. The lack of zipped pocket is a deal braker for me = no place to put my keys/id. And I am still not 100% confident that the pocket could hold my phone. Gels maybe, but I don't want to risk loosing and/or breaking my phone. I could still see myself using this short to go to the gym or run on a treadmill but certainly not for outdoor activities. While not a deal breaker, more pockets (for gels, phone. gloves, etc) would be a plus.

title: Disappointed
text: I've been loyal user of the previous version of these shorts and loved them! I'm VERY DISAPPOINTED with the update Lululemon made to the shorts! The liner is the most uncomfortable ever, I prefer liner-less shorts because I wear my own size compression short. I also dislike the new length, it just crops-up too high when doing exercise activities. I don't understand why Lululemon made this update and I would concur with previous reviewers, it was an unnecessary change to a problem it did NOT exist. I have definitely stopped buying these shorts and been looking at other alternatives besides Lululemon. I also feel like the patterns are extremely noisy and fall for the mainstream design of other generic brands.

title: So disappointed!
text: I find the reviews here super helpful, so even though my experience with these new shorts wasn't great I have found these reviews helpful as a I look for new stuff, so, here it goes. I am an original Surge Short devotee, I own more than a dozen pairs. Absolutely the best shorts Lulu has ever made. Loved the pocket, the elastic waistband loop is amazing for inversions in practice as well as for hot runs and the fabric has held up over time, so well in fact that many pairs I own look brand new even after 100s of washes. Now, all of that said, I have been very patiently waiting for the release of these shorts. Yes, I own the linerless version, they are nice, as are the shorter lengths, it's just, well, nothing is as good as the original. By now I don't need to explain my excitement when I got my weekly email of new releases and saw my prayers had been answered and my beloved shorts were updated and released! I ordered every color and even in two sizes, just to make sure the fit was right. Well, I eagerly jumped into my fresh shorts for Monday morning practice and only about 20 minutes in I was in agony. The liner of the shorts kept riding up causing a chain reaction that though it's hard to describe here, let's just say that these shorts are ball crushers!I tried everything, pulled liner down over and over, adjusted, tightened and loosened waistband, nothing worked. Frustrated, I went home and examined the shorts to try and identify the source of my, um, discomfort. Don't know what it is exactly, but the liner just doesn't have the appropriate shape/pouch for, well, you know. I have never really experienced this issue and certainly not in the nearly 100 pairs of Lulu bottoms (shorts, trainers, briefs, pants, joggers, Etc). Hoping this is glitch in the newly released design and that future versions will be more, um, "roomy". Ever-faithful!

We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us.We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us. Please keep an eye on your inbox as I'll be reaching out shortly to connect.

title: NEW White Surge Shorts 6"
text: I have purchased the Surge Shorts in the past and I notice some slight changes. I really like the new lining on the inside. Instead of being a simple net, they have made a very flexible, comfortable built-in compression material (with a small pocket stitched into the right leg) which I like! Instead of the zippered back pocket, they have the band of the shorts fold over a small pocket in the back. Feels a little cheap and I preferred the zippered pocket. With these small changes, I prefer the older style, but these are still nice! In terms of the color, they are VERY white (which I love), but be prepared for them to get dirty quickly. Overall they fit great and I'm very pleased!

title: Perfect fit for between Medium and Large
text: I'm 5'10, 160 lbs with a 40.5 inch chest. What this means is that I am perfectly in between a medium and a large size, though I'm a large with 90% of the Lulu products (Medium everywhere else).You have to be careful if you're someone like me there are certain certain of this model which vary by size, and choosing a Large will look baggy and unruly, while choosing Medium would be uncomfortably tight and awkward looking. Lulu's always been good about returns and exchanges when I have got the wrong size online however, so nbd if you make the wrong choice. Bottom line, they are my go to every day shirt, and hold up nicely over the years. I generally put my performance shirts though the works but I still have 3 year old vent techs sitting in my closet.

title: Deteriorating quality
text: I've been a high volume consumer of Lulu clothing for a few years now. The Metal Vent Tech t-shirts and Polos sold me on the brand. The new version seem to be an attempt to maximize profit by reducing quality. The design seems to have been simplified by removing the back side technical pattern which gave the shirt a more high end appearance and provided better breathability for workout hot spots. They also don't seem to be holding up as well either. They seem to stretch and sag a bit more as well as pilling. I sincerely hope Lulu chooses to drive loyalty and repeat sales by improving quality rather than pursue short sighted cost cutting to raise margins. I have always loved them for the innovative high quality materials and construction so please don't change that.

title: Decent after 6 months, but retains sweat and becomes heavy
text: I received this shirt as a gift after getting into yoga last year. It has held up well to weekly washings and yoga 4-5 times a week. Another positive is the anti-stink technology. Unfortunately, it soaks up sweat like a sponge... so much so that I've resorted to only wearing it to lighter activity sessions. During more intense exercise, as you sweat, the shirt begins to feel incredibly heavy and sticky. Savasana becomes difficult, as I can't wait to peel myself from the fabric. Additionally, I have to be incredibly delicate while pulling it over my head as it feels like it's about to rip at any moment due to the added weight from the moisture absorption. I actually think a less stretchy fabric would benefit this model, perhaps by reducing the sweat retention.

title: Good Fit
text: Overall the shirt fit well. Very light and a good running shirt. I wish the shirt was a little more fitted with a stretch similar to the 2012 athletic shirts.

title: Amazing shirt
text: Great shirts, I've grown my collection to 8 so far and love them all but for some reason after washing the last two that I bought for the first time the lulu sign on the back has faded almost entirely. Not sure why considering I cold wash and hang dry and this has not happened to my other ones.

like: comfortable, breathable, amazing quality in texture, perfect tennis shirt
not_like: slight tear after 1 wear/wash, price for quality in return
title: Short Lasting Shirt
text: I just got 3 Lululemon shirts as a gift from my girlfriend and one of them was the Metal Vent Tech Short Sleeve in a lightish blue color. Every shirt I got was amazing in the way it felt - it was just insane how comfortable the shirts were. The problem is that after I played tennis in my shirt once and washed the shirt I noticed that the shirt was slightly tearing in the back. It's not noticeable from a distance, but holes after 1 wear and wash? My girlfriend didn't keep the receipt, so I won't be returning the other two shirts, but I'll definitely just get them dry cleaned from now on.
response:
Hey TennisTech,
I'm sorry to hear of the holes in your shirt, what a bummer! We'd love to dig deeper into this and help turn your experience around. Please keep your eyes out for a follow-up email headed your way.

not_like: material stains, wrinkles up and hard to get out, poor construction
title: Disappointing product
text: I bought two of the Metal Vent Tech T-shirts and was very happy with them throughout my first week of use. After washing them in cold water and air-drying, I noticed stains already. It was a lighter shirt, and pit stains were very obvious after another handwash. On top, the shirt kept wrinkling up. Honestly, this was a very nice shirt until the quality of fabric showed itself in the first week. I was very excited, but it was a letdown.

title: Not Impressed
text: I was very hesitant to purchase a new product from this company after wearing Nike from years, especially at this steep price point for a shirt. However, it seemed to be very comfortable and stylish in the store so I decided to give it a try and frankly I wish I wouldn't have. The shirt started to get weird stains after just one wear without heavy sweating, not to mention the excessive wrinkling. After this experience, I do not believe I will be a returning customer.

title: can't workout in anything else
text: I bought one shirt just randomly to see what it was all about, and now I wear it more than anything else. The shirt is so comfy to work out in, and it wicks away my sweat, and thats saying a lot

like: easy-to-tear-off tag, fit, moisture wicking performance
title: Great design, fit and performance
text: First LULU purchase. Have worn Nike Dri-Fit for years and just wanted to try something new. Fabric is noticeably thicker, softer and stretchier than standard Dri-Fit, yet still light weight. Moisture wicking for one who sweats a lot like I do is as good or better than Dri-Fit, and less "clingy" when wet with perspiration. Fit is good. Length is perfect in medium (6'0'', 160 lbs).

not_like: staining, inconsistent sizing, not really feeling assured by your return policy
title: Can't wait to return. buyer be ware
text: I bought 2 of these shirts and a pair of shorts. first time purchasing Lululemon btw. After making the purchase, I read several reviews about the poor quality (i.e. inconsistent sizing, staining, etc.) of these shirts and was very hesitant to remove the tags. After just one wear of 30 minutes, and after the shirt had dried, I already started noticing the staining in random areas. I also compare the fit of both the size Large shirts and sure enough, one is at least an inch shorter than the other. I'll be returning all my items and going back to the brands that have always served me well such as Nike. Sorry Lulu, I tried.
response:
Hi Stevo1983,
Thanks for taking the time to reach out to us. We stand behind the quality of our gear and if our gear doesn't perform for you - we'd love to help you out. Give our Guest Education Centre a call at 1.877.263.9300 and they'll help work on a resolution with you.

title: Great fit
text: I have this in a few colors.. It is really a good fit. it does not make you sweat and it doesn't smell when you have a hard workout. It fits good and has kept really well after many washes. I would get more of these for sure.

title: Poor quality
text: This is the first product that I have purchased from Lululemon that I've been disappointed with. I recently ordered a couple of these and the quality if pretty poor. Like others have noted in reviews, sweat stains formed on the chest and underarms of the lighter colored shirt after just three wears and will not come out. I've followed the cleaning instructions to a tee, used high quality detergent, and air dried. No luck. Unfortunately, I had to toss the shirt because of the obvious stains. Three wears out of a $68 shirt is pretty steep.

title: Almost Amazing
text: After a great experience with my Surge 7" shorts I thought it would be appropriate to try out the great looking Metal Vent Shirt that caught my eye at the store. After trying it on it was an easy decision to buy, the only question was in how many colors! I'm 5'11, 170 lbs with a muscular build and can have a difficult time finding shirts with a good cut for my frame. Well, I needn't look any further as this shirt seemingly had it all, perfect fit and length, great feel and a stylish look that worked both for the gym and as casual wear. If I wrote this review after the first few times I wore the shirt it would have received 4 stars (out of 5). After a few washes and adhering to the care instructions I was bummed out when I noticed that the shirt started to develop bacon strips on the collar which is unacceptable (especially at the cost) and disappointing as I thought my search was over for training shirts moving forward I was totally ready to pick up one for every day of the week in a variety of colors.
response:
Hey Steels,
We're sorry to hear of your disappointment with the bacon neck you've experienced and would like to do some digging into this so we can pass along your feedback to the relevant team. An email is on the way so we can work towards a fix together.
Speak soon.

not_like: seams, neck opening, price, defective fabric, looks cheap
title: Poor craftsmanship, decent materials
text: the quality of the stitching is sub par, especially at this price point. the fabric is bunched up at the shoulders because the material was not positioned correctly before the pieces of fabric were attached. The shirt looks cheap but costs a fortune. Also, there are lines permanently embedded in the fabric due to hanging in the store for too long.
response:

title: New White Metal Vent - Yellowing Color
text: First - I love Lulu metal vent t's. I have 5+ at this point and several are 2-3 years old and going strong. However, the new white color turned yellow with my first wear and is nearly impossible to whiten in the wash even when using the "hot" setting (which I would never use on my other Lulu clothing). I wouldn't consider myself a dirty human, it seems to be something with the white fabric. Fair warning, white is not the color to choose which is a little disappointing as I was quite excited about it. I bought a black at the same time and have had no problems with it or any of my other metal vents. Unfortunately I don't think i'll be wearing my (off) white anymore.
response:

title: Great Shirt, Unbearable Smell.
text: The shirt itself is fantastic, lightweight, breathable and works well for a variety of workouts. The only issue is the smell. The shirt is billed as odor resistant and while this is true for the first month or so, I am not able to get the smell out of this shirt no matter how hard I try. I have followed the wash instructions closely to no avail. Unfortunately, I will have to throw this shirt out as my wife has banned it from the house as a result of the smell. Unfortunate!

title: Poor Quality
text: I really loved this shirt when bought it and have several of them. I got a light blue colored one recently and wear it to work out in. I sweat some when I work out and after only a few wears sweat stains formed on the chest and made the shirt unwearable. I followed every instruction for caring for the product before the issue and tried every suggestion to get it out, but the stain remains. When I spoke with customer service they suggested that I must have spilled something on it (which I didn't) and basically told me that it was my fault. I've never had this happen with any other shirt this badly after so few wears. Way too much money to pay for a shirt that I can only wear a few times. I love how comfortable it is, but I am very disappointed with this shirt and the customer service I received.

title: Inconsistent Sizing
text:

I have a white one that's a little loose in the body and long in the sleeves so I roll them up once and it's looks pretty good. I also have a black one that fits near perfect in body and length so I'm a tad bit disappointed because the store in my area does not have any more riviera blue in my size and I'm sure a medium will be too big.

like: design, feel, workmanship, fit, versatility, scent (smells fresh!)

product: Metal Vent Tech Short Sleeve Henley
title: Love Color Selection, Sizing Inconsistent?
text:
The Henley is my favorite and I am pleased that newer and more neutral colors are available this spring. However, these are 2 concerns:
1) the sizing seems inconsistent - 2017 models seem to be cut tighter with shorter sleeves. I found out the hard and expensive way. I assumed that the same size from last year would fit so I tore the tags off only to find that the shirt was skin tight. So I had to request an a return (this was an online purchase) but was only able to receive merchandise credit
(which I have yet to receive) and then had to re-purchase in store. The same size purchased in store fit more consistent with other Metal Vents I own.
2) this years Metal Vent doesn't seem as durable. Pulls very easily compared to previous years models.
Time will tell how well this years Henley holds up but I like the colors offered this season.

title: Stay Away - Bonded Seams
text: I love the design of these shorts and the addition of three pockets is awesome. However, the bonded seams don't wear very well, as over time they loose their shape and become warped. Causing the shorts to look awful. Would recommend staying away from these.

text:
I had to replace my surge 7" short because the zipper broke. However, I do not like the new style of surge shorts with the zippered pocket at the back which led me to these.
These are the perfect size, perfect fit. I love the two zippered pockets on the sides and the hidden back pocket as well.

title: DO NOT BUY THIS!
text: I have purchased a lot of Lululemon goods. Some great (I have chased a pair of pants to a store 3 states away), some disappoint; but this thing is absolutely horrible. I used it for a run when the weather finally got warmer. I was looking forward to this warm spring run. This thing destroyed the run. It annoyed me to the ends of the earth. Its like it is engineering from the ground up to annoy its unfortunate wearer. I will give it this, the garment is light weight and fabric feels kinda cool, but yet the hood weighs about the times as much as the rest of it so its awkward. The hood drags the garment up you in a weird way and it feels heavy on your back and generally uncomfortable. The collar and zippers are engineered in such a manner that ensures either side is always in the perfect position to drag the zipper clear across your neck. They even reinforced the edges of the to make absolutely certain there is weight to drag this thing uncomfortably on any part of your sweaty neck it can. My neck is raw from the zipper dragging on my run. If this was the only thing I owned from Lululemon, I would probably never return. Its that awful. Blew $100 on something I am never.... EVER.... going to wear again! Pass on this one!

title: What a disappointment
text: I bought this jacket on final sale thinking it would be perfect for summer going to the gym or riding my bike. Little did I know that it would fit different then other lululemon jackets that I own. The jacket is made of such a thin material that you can basically see the shirt you’re wearing underneath. The biggest disappoint though is the color in the picture this looks like it’s a bright orange, but when I opened my package up the color was more a darker rust looking color. For this type of price point I expected a way nicer product. I wouldn’t recommend this windbreak to anyone look elsewhere.

title: Alright, will have to test in rain
text: First off, the color in the pictures looks much better than the actual color. Ordered a size up from my normal size because I wanted to wear something under this, but just wearing a t-shirt makes the jacket fit snug. I would recommend ordering at least one size up if you plan on wearing anything under it.

title: Magnifique coupe-vent!

title: No draw sting for the hood!

It was functioning perfectly, keeping the wind out, but when it came to using the hood there was no draw string to cinch it tight. I ended up having to hold the hood down during windy walk commutes..

title: All is perfect...wish had side pockets

Otherwise looking for a good pair of running shorts without pockets they’re great.

title: Good shorts... No side pockets

title: Just okay

like: stretch, light weight, length, elastic waist, color, card pocket
title: Great for a workout!
text: I love these shorts, they're stretchy and great for a workout. VERY light weight, you forget that you're wearing anything! These are great for running.

title: Finally A Pair of LuLus for Me
text: I have been going to LuLu with the wife for some time now and finally found a pair of shorts for me. I was a little hesistant at first because they fit so tight around my quads/hamstrings, but a couple of air squats proved these shorts would work for me.

title: Best workout shorts
text: These are the best shorts we've found for squatting, running, jumping, and all the exercises we do on a daily basis. They hold up the abuse and last forever.

title: Falling apart
text: I bought these shorts because I liked the inseam length and fit. I washed the shorts and dried them twice. In cold water and low heat...

title: Not Just for Running
text: I generally don't like big oversized shorts so I bought these in a size smaller than I usually wear. This gave me a more snug fit without feeling like my usual cycling tights. This gave them a feel of some of my favorite trail running shorts from Salomon.

title: Almost there
text: The back of the shirt has the greatest design ive seen on any lulu shirts... i wish that design was on the metal vent shirts as well. Only problem with this shirt is that the sleeves and shirt itself are wayyyyyyyy too short.

title: Awesome Shirt
text: Versatile, lightweight and breathes. Love this shirt.

title: Good for looks only
text: Shirt looks great. That's about it. Went running wearing it and it did not do a good job wicking sweat. I bought 2 colors, red and blue so I will just use them as cool casual shirts.
response:
Hey DarthGman,

Thank you for taking the time to review the Runway Short Sleeve. That doesn't sound right! Please feel free to give our GEC a call or SMS us at 1.877.263.9300 to continue this conversation.

not_like: fit, wrinkles, does not wick sweat, sticks to the body
title: Sub Par Shirt
text: This Shirt is not the quality shirt I have come to expect. If this was my first lululemon shirt I would not buy the brand again. I have a little over half dozen metal vent tech shirts and this does not preform anywhere close to those. The fit is awkward, the seams and collar wrinkle and bunch up after one wash. (cold wash, hang dry) While working out the shirt becomes really heavy and sticks to the body. I really like the reflective detail on the back of the shirt which is why i bought it but i no longer wear it because it looks so wrinkled and preforms so badly.
response:
Hey smith93,

Thanks for taking the time to share your experience with us! We definitely want all of your gear to perform for you, and we're sorry to hear that the Runway Short Sleeve missed the mark. Stay tuned for an email coming your way - we'd love to turn this around!

title: Not Worth It
text: While the aesthetics of this shirt are unique and cool, it doesn't perform well at all. If you're going for a light jog, you'll probably be fine, but if you do anything more, I'd buy something else. Once you start to sweat, the shirt immediately begins to stick to your body. As you continue to sweat, the shirt gets more and more wet and suctions itself to you. On top of that, it takes forever to dry. I've hung it up and left it for 12 hours, expecting it to by dry, only to find that it was still very damp. Spend your money on something else.
response:
Hey DannyH,

Thanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. We stand behind the quality of our product, and we want to ensure that you're in gear that is performing well for you. I hear that this is not the case and would like to work with you to create a resolution. Please keep an eye on your inbox as I'll be reaching out shortly to connect.

title: 5” of over sized baggy
text: I am 6’4” so I figured these would be short and perhaps tight on my thighs based on the picture and how skinny that guy looked. Got them and they are long and very loose around my thighs, my wife wears them for cleaning more then I wear them. Color is also a bit much looked better in the picture. Material it is made of is like plastic and very cheap. Older shorts that I have are better quality but feel like plastic.
response:
Hey Dourds,

Thanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. I completely understand why you're disappointed with this and I'd love to help turn this around. We'd love to learn more and make things right for you, so keep an eye out for an email coming your way.

like: lightweight feel, discreet back pocket comfortably holds items, very comfortable for running
not_like: very fragile for the price, may be better off hand washing in very gentle soap, expected far better durability
title: Decent Running Shorts
text: These shorts held up very well until the first or second wash. Some deterioration and discoloration was noticed despite following the laundering instructions. I decided to keep them as they are very light and comfortable for running, hiking, training, and so on, but I will probably choose a more durable pair of shorts when replacing these when they completely disintegrate by the tenth wash. I felt that returning them for a replacement pair would be pointless as I did not purchase them based solely on aesthetics but for performance and durability.
response:
Hey Luluver,

We’re writing to follow up on your recent review. We want your gear to support your sweatiest pursuits and it sounds like your Surge Short *Linerless Online Only 5" isn’t up to the task. We’d love to turn this around and get you into gear that works for you. Look out for an email from us soon!

like: design and fit., light weight, loved the reflective strip.
not_like: no gift bag! use to get them on all orders.
title: Great fit and feel
text: Enjoyed wearing the surge shorts while hiking, running and walking. They look great when I wear them with my INKnBURN shirts. Have been buying lululemon shorts for the past six years. A little disappointed not receiving a gift bag the last three online orders! I’ll have to make my purchases in person.

title: No pockets
text: These shorts are great other than the fact that they don’t have any usable pockets. The rear pocket is small and it looks like you are scratching your butt when you go to access it

title: Great short for summer months
text: These shorts are great for an afternoon run or the anytime WOD. I love the lightweight feature of all the 5" shorts. I only wish that there were more 5" AND linerless short color/design options!

title: Almost everything I want in a pair of gym shorts.
text: These shorts are amazing. I just wish i could get a 5” inseam short with pockets. I understand these are running shorts but I wear shorter shorts normally for lifting and no one makes running shorts with pockets.

title: Nice Shorts But They Are Thin
text: I bought these short for running. They are of good quality, but definitely on the thinner side, which is why I didn't give 5 stars. If that's what you're looking for, these are great. However, personally I would have preferred a slightly thicker, more durable material.

title: Almost Perfect Everyday Short
text: These shorts are excellent when you're working out and traveling light. The fabric is great, and the 5" inseam is great for shorter guys like me. That said, these shorts would be 5 star shorts if they had one more pocket!

title: Not that durable and small
text: My girlfriend gave me this as a gift a month ago and after wearing them twice the zipper on the back no longer works. I am disappointed in this quality. The sizing was very tight as well. I am usually a small in lulu shorts, however they are way too tight. This makes me rethink buying lulus in the future.
response:
Hey bob12345,
Thanks so much for taking the time to get in touch today and share your thoughts. I'm sorry to hear about the broken zipper on your shorts. Keep an eye out for an email I'll be sending your way so we can help you find a resolution. Chat soon!

title: Literally best pair of shorst I've owned
text: So a few months ago, my friend suggested Lulu Lemon to me and I'll tell you that this was the best decision I've made (clothing-wise haha). She told me that she always get Lulu apparel and its really great so I decided to give it a shot. I am a cross country runner so the first workout I did with them was a 12 mile run. They were amazing the whole time, they have some type of little thing to weigh them down on the end so it doesn't flap around everywhere and they're super light. They are super sweat wicking and I'd buy a hundred more If I could.

title: Underwhelming
text: I love all the pairs (6+) of Lululemon shorts that I have but this one not so much. It's quite a bit snug (and I've lost weight too) as compared to the previous Medium sized Lululemon shorts. The length is fine. If I knew that the was more fitted, I would have ordered a size Large instead. Good thing I got it linerless as I've seen the reviews about the sub-par quality of the liner material. Too bad I can't exchange them.

title: Size up
text: I bought these for my boyfriend and they ended up being way too tight and much MUCH shorter than expected. Definitely size up if you are going to buy these but otherwise I would look at the 7" shorts . I've never been disappointed with Lulu lemon's products but if I could return/ exchange these I would! Looks great until worn, overall really disappointed with this purchase!

title: My favorite shorts
text: These shorts are awesome. I bought a pair last year and fell in love with them. They are so versatile and great for anything. I wear them literally every day to and from classes and around the dorm and to the gym. I've worn them to yoga, to pilates, while cycling, on the treadmill, on the elliptical, at zumba, etc. and they've been perfect. Other comments talked about bad quality, but I own about 5 or 6 pairs and have never had a problem.

title: Wouldn't recommend
text: I received a pair of these about a month ago and absolutely loved them, until the elastic on the waistband stretched out and no longer fit. If you plan on buying these, I would suggest ordering a size up just in case.
response:
Hi Brendann,
Thanks for taking the time to share this feedback with us. We stand behind the quality of our gear, and want to make sure it's performing for you. I understand that this isn't the case, and would like to work with you to find a resolution. I’ve sent you an email to follow up. Chat with you soon.

title: Too tight
text: I would recommend getting a larger size than normal. Or definitely going to the store before purchasing. Most of the time I'm in love with lululemon's products because they are not an expensive brand that does not have results. They really put out quality products definitely worth the money. However with this short, I found that the inner liner and the shorts in general start to get extremely uncomfortable on my inner thigh after just a bit of leisurely activity much less running and tend to ride up making it that much more uncomfortable. As someone who wears lululemon shorts and spends a good amount of money on these products. I was pretty disappointed with this product and pretty much just wear them around the house when I run out of my other quality shorts. I'm not sure if the sizing changes for each type of shorts or pants, but I would say try on the pants if they don't have your size in the shorts you want in store.

like: the fit! long enough for a 6’2” man in a large, the shape retention, the design features
title: Excellent!
text: I love this shirt! It’s something I can wear to work with a pair of commission slims and some loafers to dress it up, or I can rock it at barre class, yoga, or even CrossFit! I believe in having clothing that is versatile. This one fits my criteria for that :) and it’s a great color!

title: LS metal top
text: Nice long sleeve. I bought this for my husband after getting the SS version.

title: Long Sleeves make you look cool
text: Love the length of sleeves and fit across chest.

title: Excellent material, loses shape after a wash
text:
I purchased two Commission Slim pants and two surge jogger pants in store. I loved them so much, I went ahead and order 6 more shirts (tops) online, all from "We made too much" section. 3 of them were great, and the other 3 were terrible.
One of that was this Metal Vent Tech Long Sleeve. It was amazing to wear the first time, and I simply loved it - the fabric was soft and very nice. After one wash (and dry), in the delicate cycle, it started losing shape and now I use it as my night pajama shirt since it is useless to wear it outside.
response:
Hi SriSeattle,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We are sorry to hear that your shorts are not performing for you, and we would love to help. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!

title: Bring back the old Metal Vent style please!
text: This shirt is substantially inferior to the old Metal Vent long sleeves. For starter, the fabric is completely different, there are no finger holes, uncomfortable, and less attractive. Please bring back the old metal vent style!
response:
Dear LanceMiller,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. That doesn't sound like a good experience at all! Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!

title: Delightful Shirt
text: I own a few other metal vent tech styles from Lulu (the Henley and the wool long sleeve) and have loved all. I'm 6 feet tall and slender, so I usually purchase a size small in order to have a more fitted shirt and thus warmer.

title: HORRIBLE Quality
text: While i buy practically all my apparel from Lululemon, im quite disappointed with this purchase. While the fit is great as always, the quality of the fabric extremely uncomfortable. The fibers on the inside make this Tee very itchy. i had to take it off after 2 minutes! no wonder this tee is final sale!! they know that once you buy it, youll be sure to want to return it!
response:
Hey Moemoney,
Thanks for taking the time to share your feedback. We would love to get a bit more information on your experience, and look into some options. An email is headed your way, so keep an eye out.

title: Not excpected
text: I am a fan of the "Metal Vent Tech" line. I have bought at least 5 of the T-shirts and long sleeves and have had no problems. I expected this shirt to be the same amazing quality however, after the first wash it started pilling and it just isn't the same quality. That being said I am hopeful it is just a faulty product as I love all my other lulu shirts. Its unfortunate it was a final sale or id exchange it.
response:
Hey luluenthusiast2,
We hear your disappointment with the pilling you're experiencing on your gear and will be sending an email your way so we can dig into this with you.

title: Husband Loves This Shirt
text: My husband has always said that Lululemon is too expensive, and didn't understand why I would spend so much money on clothes. I did some research, and thought this would be a great first piece for him, especially being on mark down. In store I found the grey color. He tried it on, and loved it. He said it was very comfortable, and liked the looser fit. He is also a generally sweaty guy, so having the anti-stink technology is really helpful. He loves this shirt so much that he wears it almost everywhere; to class, working out, walking the dogs, hanging around the house, running errands etc. It is the perfect shirt for spring, summer, and fall. Winter it won't be warm enough here, but I think it would be a good layering piece. The reason that I like this shirt is because it's very flattering on my husband. Specifically the stitching on the upper neck-area of the shirt. Finding a shirt that not only feels good physically, but makes him feel good mentally is a win-win. Whether you are looking into getting your first piece of Lululemon, or whether you are just looking to add to your collection, I highly recommend giving this one a try. We hand wash our Lululemon, inside out in order to preserve it the longest!

title: LuLu Newbie
text: I dont get into yoga and have a big butt and legs and for those reasons stayed away from LuLu. This was my first shirt/short combo and I loved both so much I ordered a couple more online (and today ordered another) I love the look, the fit and quality of the product. I am going to try to get into a store this week to try the slim pants on and hope I manage to get my big butt into them because they look awesome.

not_like: pilling on front after a couple of washes
title: Perfect Fit - Poor Quality
text: I want to start off by saying I'm a huge Lululemon enthusiast. It's my favorite brand of clothing and I have anywhere from 15-20 articles of clothing currently in my closet which I wear daily. At 6'4 I have a hard time getting clothing that's long enough for me while at the same time not being too baggy. Lulu manages to find the happy medium between the two. This shirt was no different. I tried it on and absolutely loved the fit and like most trips to Lulu, walked out with a new purchase. I was happy to wear the shirt to the gym but after a few washes there was a large amount of pilling on the front of the shirt which looks awful. I washed according to proper instructions but it didn't make a difference. It's the first time I've ever had a quality issue with any of my purchases from here. I will likely continue to shop at Lululemon but I am not happy about this most recent purchase.
response:
Hey Newfoundlander,
Thanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We hear your disappointment and will be sending an email your way to follow up and lend a helping hand.
Speak soon.

title: Love lulu clothes, but this is horrible

title: Excellent Shirt
text: Being 6'5 215 Its hard for me to find shirts that fit. Although I agree with the one reviewer that said lulu should have a line of tall products. However this has been one of the best shirts I have ever had. It offers just enough room in the arms and in the torso for me to move comfortably without feeling restricted. Not only does the Large fit well it is also extremely comfortable. It is a completely different feel to Nike or Under Armour products. As well as the fit is completely different.I rowed crew in college and we were an under armor school and Under armour shirts tend the be really tight and short or really short and baggy (Large vs. XL) and lulu shirts do not present that problem.

title: Great shirt, not up to standard
text: I have bought quite a few items from lulu, and I usually have no complaints. The main reason why I'm okay with spending the money is the quality of the clothing and material. I bought this shirt even after I read reviews that the shirt pulled or pilled up. I just figured that the user wasn't taking care of the clothing properly. When it comes to my lulu clothing I take care of it differently from my other clothing. Gentle cycles and never dry. I have washed this shirt once and have already had pilling on the front. I love everything about the shirt except this small flaw in the construction of this shirt. I would recommend the shirt, but even from the we made too much section it's not worth $60.00
response:
Hi Csouz,
We're sorry to hear you're experiencing pilling with your Metal Vent Tech Long Sleeve. We stand behind the quality of our product, and we want to ensure that you're in gear that is performing well for you. Please give our GEC a call- 1.877.263.9300 as they'll be able make some recommendations about how to proceed. .

title: Lulu's sizing akin to Old Navy
text: I have 5 Metal Vent tech, size large, shirts. 2 are skin tight, 1 fits well, and 2 absolutely hang off of me. I recently purchased this one, and it falls into the HUGE category.

title: Inconsisting sizing
text: The sizing is inconsistent. I own a large which is too big and now a medium which is too small. Would have given it more than one star though if not for the terrible customer service I received over the phone/chat earlier. Buyer beware- no matter how loyal of a customer you might be, if you purchase an item from their "We made too much" section and it just so happens that their sizing is off, you will be stuck with your purchase. They were not even willing to let me purchase the large size and return the medium size which would have made sense for everyone. They lost a good customer as a result.

not_like: didn't hold up, intant pilling and fraying
title: intant pilling
text: Bought this shirt for my husband. He loved it in the store because it was so soft and comfy. He wore it 1x and it is already pilling, fraying in some places as well as fuzzy in about 4 areas. We wash all out lulu together in cold and hang to dry with all zippers fully zipped.
response:
Hey mkroberson,

title: 4 months later!
text: I bought this shirt 4 months ago, one of my first lulu products. Super comfy, great mobility, love the shirt. But it has started to pill in multiple places and I only bought it 4 months ago.

Thanks for taking the time to reach out to us about your Metal Vent Tech Long Sleeve. I'm sorry that you're experiencing pilling with yours. title: new versions are slimmer
text: I got this shirt 2 years ago and I remember it being longer. I realized the current version is a little slimmer and shorter for which I have no problems about. My concern though (besides the price increase) are those thumb holes. At least in my anatomy, they don't work pretty well. I wanted to get it hemmed but it will look shorter. I wanted to return it but I need it. I am so confused!

title: Great for Women who don't like tight sleeves
text:
I got a women's swiftly, and the arms are so tight that I have to pull on the fabric to get the sleeve over my hands and adjusted comfortably on my arms. I have read how fragile the fabric is, so I am always worried I will put a hole in it just from wrestling it on.
I got the women's 2 sizes too big just for the arms to be comfortable. However, the body of the shirt makes me look like a lego guy, round and shapeless, but at least I can put my arms in it without too much of a fight.
I got this shirt because we go mining, and I needed something breathable, easy to take on and off, long sleeved to protect my arms from sun and scrapes, and stink free.
I wore it mining yesterday and I was very comfortable. I could push the sleeves up when I needed to (which I cannot do in the women's), easily put them back down, quickly put my thumbs in the thumbholes and put my gloves back on without a second thought, it was oversized enough that I never felt like my shirt was pulling or I had to adjust it while I'm on the side of a mountain.
As a bonus, when we got off the mountain and were eating dinner at the base, the cooler breeze started to pick up and I was still comfortable.
I like the colors of the women's swiftly, and I will wear it around town, however for function and working, this is the shirt I will be wearing. I only wish men's came in something besides black and grey! Don't men like some color too? I want to be seen when I'm on the side of the hill, not blend in!
For reference, i am a women's 8 in swiftlys, and I got a medium in mens. It's roomy and comfortable, and I don't look like a lego man.

title: Nice shirt, minor size difference
text: I bought a S short sleeve and a S long sleeve, and the size difference is big. The SS is smaller and tighter fit than the LS.

ageRange: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.
title: a new favorite
text: I love this shirt, so I've just bought a 3rd in the light blue color. It actually is sized appropriately unlike many Lululemon products - I wear medium shirts and the medium fits perfectly. The weight of it is very versatile, good for a little chill in the air, yet comfortable if it is also warm. The feel of it is also great. One of my fave Lulu products.

title: $$$$ tee
text: I loved the way it looked online but when I went to the store and got it for $80 I saw no difference between it and a $2 shirt from Target
response:
Hi sporty1232,
We want you to know that quality is at the heart of everything we do, including our product. If something isn't making that grade, we will make it right for you. Give us a call at the GEC (1.877.263.9300) so we can chat and reach a resolution for you.

title: Wow Wow Wow
text: I absolutely love this shirt, got it shipped to me in 2 business days and I love it! It feels nice, what a nice color, I get so many compliments. I like the material and the little breathable holes in the back.

title: Warning, this shirt has been redesigned!
text: I purchased this shirt as a birthday gift for a male member of my family who has 4 of these shirts. I purchased his regular size and it is much smaller around the body and in the neck. He can't go any larger as it is the XXL, sooo disappointed that this shirt no longer fits him ... the old one was perfect! It was also Lululemons's loosest fitting shirt, now there is nothing for him.

like: loose on me, soft, easy to layer
title: sz 4 woman loves it in sz S
text:
I got this to use as an oversized lightweight pullover for spring/summer. First time wearing today to/from hot yoga & really love it! I'm 5'4" 35,25,35 so it is very loose but sooo comfy! I love that it fits over my flowy lulu tops (right now wearing over the heat the street onesie) & I don't have to wash after every wear since loose in the armpit area (silverescent doesn't really work for me 100%). I also love that I can easily roll/push up the sleeves if wearing around the house (not possible w the girl version - have to fold those up & it's kind of a process). Last - I'll be able to easily use as maternity wear - ha! It is super delicate of course but I knew that already - I have a few of the swiftly women pieces & just treat them w utmost care - wash by hand & hang dry. I've seen so many reviews of folks complaining about this fabric snagging in the wash. Honestly you should know already that it's delicate & don't buy unless willing to wash by hand. Oh it also stops at my hips (so not hangy looking) & is slightly fitted in the chest when I stand up straight w a real bra on.
:)

title: Great Shirt!
text: This shirt has a awesome fit. It is long enough in the body, that it doesn't ride up when doing squats, deadlifts, pull-ups, or any other exercises. It also looks really good, and can easily be pulled off as an around town shirt, without looking too sporty. I'm buying another one right now.

title: Love this shirt, only one complaint...
text: Ok, so I love this shirt - I have it in two colours and would love it in a few more. I wear them for going about daily tasks, and they're great for a workout or sweat session.

title: fabric way too long, does not fit average height
text: I bought this shirt and the length of the shirt went down to my knees. Not too sure why the company wasted fabric on it when Im a 5 foot 9 individual. I finally got it hemmed by lulu and they hemmed it way shorter then it was pinned. It does not even fall past my belt line now. usually buy these frequently but never again.

title: don't like the thumbhole
text: I really loved the last version of this tech shirt, but the thumbholes on the new version need to go. They make the shirt less comfortable and in my mind less attractive.

like: fabric, lightweight, cool, colors, comfort, fit
title: It's not quite the same
text: I love the fabric and functionality of this shirt. I have a bunch of the older models without the thumbholes. I do like the idea of thumbholes, so I thought I'd give the shirt a try but it is just weird. It looks like a moth ate my shirt or a rip in the sleeve. Just having open thumbholes in a shirt doesn't seem right. My sweat sessions 1/2 zips and hoodies have "hidden" thumbholes which I think solves the problem that these shirts have. Please Lulu, update tall metal vent tech long sleeves with hidden thumbholes, so you can satisfy both parties of your customers!

title: Good for really sweat activities
text: As an athlete (figure skater)I love skating in those long sleeves shirts( i have three of those).The first thing I like that even i always sweat a lot on the ice,the shirt doesn't show that my armpits are sweating so I'm not afraid to have more movements with my arms up.The second thing a like that the fabric is so amazing and the shirt is light,which makes my movements on the ice easier,because I don't feel any pressure from my shirt.The last thing I like that it fits really nice and looks good and i can wear this shirt on my official practices (I'm going to Us Championship) and all i can say-I love it.

title: Pretty Good
text: I love the shirt, however; a week after I bought it, there was a small thread coming out of the right sleeve. It's not a huge deal but for a 74 dollar shirt I expected a little more.

title: great top!
text: I got this top for my boyfriend and he absolutely loves it, mainly because he said it's comfortable. He wears medium standard t-shirts, 5'10" weighing 145lbs and I got him a medium. It is loose on him, how he prefers, but I presume a small would have also worked. He especially likes having a shirt with thumbholes.

title: Perfect fit.
text: Lightweight, easy fit, good stretch, and yes, THUMBHOLES. It isn't compression, almost fitted, just hangs well and out of the way...you forget it's there, and in the end, isn't that the point?

title: Thumbholes, YES!!!
text: I participate in High Interval Training and tough cardio workouts. I sweat a lot! I have found that the thumbholes help keep my hands dry as I grip dumbells, do burpees etc. Keep the thumbholes!

title: Thumbholes for the win!
text: I love the thumbholes on these shirts, as much as any other reviewer has stated the opposite. I don't see what is wrong with them, as they are a great alternative to a lighter weight glove that you want to end up shedding half way through your workout.

title: Perfect
text: I don't understand why people are complaining about the thumb holes. Here's an idea- don't put your thumbs in them if you don't like them. I bought this shirt specifically because it HAS thumb holes. When I run, I hate how my UA long sleeve shirts "ride up" your arm while moving. I constantly have to adjust them. This shirt? It just stays perfectly in place because of the thumb holes. When I don't want the sleeve covering my hand? Wait for it.... I take my thumbs out and they're like normal sleeves! Wow! If you want to nitpick so badly over thumb holes, pretty sure the Conduct doesn't have them, and it's more or less the same shirt. Now if only there were some more solid color options...

title: Great shirt
text: Got this shirt for my husband for his birthday, he loves the fit and material...I love the anti-stink part. Fitting in with the other reviews, he does prefer no thumbholes in his shirts, but is able to overlook it for the fit and quality of the top. It's wonderfully versatile, which is another plus. He's 5'9", 180lbs and a medium was a perfect fit.

title: Great shirt, except for the thumbholes

It's such a bummer because he wore these shirts all winter long and could really use a few more... why oh why did you add thumbholes to such an awesome shirt?

title: my favorite shirt.

like: logo is well hidden making a nice design, comfortable

title: Great long sleeve shirt
text: My favorite workout shirt, by far the best long sleeve workout shirt on the market and being tall and skinny, 6'3, 185lbs, the large fits me perfectly. Most long sleeve workout shirts are either too big or too short but if you are tall, this shirt is perfect as the sleeves are long enough for anyone but it also has a nice slim fit.

title: AMAZING SHIRT!!
text: So happy that great quality lululemon is back! I have purchased two of these amazing shirts and have been more than pleased with my purchase. Great fit, great colours, great quality!!!

title: Colors

title: college student essential
text: I am a college student at UCLA and this is something I want to wear everyday when I walk around campus. I wish I could get more colors of this longsleeve so I can wear them more often but as a college student, I'm on a budget. The price is worth it. The quality of this product is unmatched. I can run miles, sweat gallons and still feel confident, not having to worry about my odor or appearance.

title: Greatest shirt ever!
text: This shirt is amazing!!! I can wear it when I'm running, at that gym, or just out and about. This shirt is so versatile and comfortable no matter what I'm doing. Plus the ladies love it too. I would wear these shirts everyday if I could, but sadly they are $74 a piece and I don't have money to blow on clothes. If you're looking for a comfortable, stylish, quality, well-fitted, and versatile long sleeve, this is the shirt for you!

title: Awesome shirt…but kinda thin
text: I have five of these MVT long sleeved shirts in various colors. I also have several of the short sleeved shirts too. I absolutely love the longed sleeved shirts and wear them when I'm doing crossfit in cooler temps. My only concern is that they damage pretty easily. I got a hole on one of mine today while working out. The fabric is pretty thin; which is great when you're working out and sweating. But the thin material can be a problem when you're doing activities like stone cleans or rolling around on the floor and the shirt gets snagged on something. Now I have a $74 workout shirt with a hole in the shoulder.

title: My go to
text: I like these shirts so much I end up wearing them on a daily basis when its chilly out with a jacket over. They're useful for everyday use and perfect at the gym. The wick away sweat quickly and keep you dry and they look great so I cant complain. I used to only wear Nike apparel while working out. I am now a LLL convert. LLL make this in a V-Neck.

title: Love the shirt, not the quote
text: This shirt is a great style, great fit, love the shirt. Neat touch with the quotes on the inside hem . . . however, "make sure to drink a beer or two along the way" Really? Lululemon promotes good living and health. That ruined the shirt for me. You could have done all of your neat quotes and leave drinking a beer off.

title: Amazing athletic shirt
text: This shirt is great for athletics, breathes great and is very comfortable. Another awesome product from Lululemon!

title: unreal
text: This shirt comes with a chick magnet installed right it it. Feels great and looks sharp. Love it!

like: soft, stretchy, fitted, durable, moisture wicking
title: Amazing Long Sleeve for Training / Running / Gym
text: This shirt is amazing. I have looked at several brands for well-designed long sleeve shirts to be used for running, training, and going to the gym. This shirt is cut very well. It is fitted, but not compressive. It is also stretchy though, so you can use a slightly smaller shirt than you would otherwise ordinarily need. Typically I am a size XL in long sleeve shirts from Nike / Under Armour etc. but in this one I am a size L because of how soft and stretchy the fabric is. I have used this shirt for power lifting, pilates, yoga, running, basketball, and other gym-related activities. It works great for all of them. Some reviews have stated that the shirt has some durability problems; however, I have several of these shirts and have washed them all numerous times - have had no trouble.

title: Great workout shirt
text: I rarely find long sleeve workout shirts that I like but I was impressed my the metal vent tech. It is a perfect fit in terms of overall length and sleeve length. With my build, it is flattering but not excessively tight to the point where the shirt would ride and bunch up if I were to move. The only issue I had was my mishandling of washing it with different colors which caused some fading in select spots. Although this was due to my own fault, it taught me a valuable laundry lesson. Even with my blemished shirt, I still wear it anyways since it does not detract from it's ability to keep me stylish and functional in the gym.

title: Not impressed
text: I wore this shirt once. It fit great!. I wore this shirt out and about but before i was able to go on a run, I washed it once and i guess it frayed and the material ended up ripping a horizontal hole in the front of the shirt about 3 inches long
response:
Hey activeE,

A hole in the front doesn't sound right and we'd love to set up a return for you. If you're near to a store, swing in and bring it to an educator. If that's not easy for you, give us a call - 1.877.263.9300 - and we can set up a return over the phone. Thanks so much for reaching out and letting us know.

title: Corse fabric / uncomfortable
text: I have a couple of these shirts in different colours and loved them however I recently purchased a new one and they must have switched the fabrics hey use. The inside is extremely corse and uncomfortable

title: Handle With Care
text: I struggled to rate this top. I really like the fabric for running (it breathes well, is comfortable, have never experienced any chafing, and the fit is good--a bit looser than I would prefer, but good. However, the fabric does not hold up well to even light abrasion. I wore this for an early morning 8 mile run and the result was several "pull" marks where the threads were getting caught on the venting holes and the back pocket zipper pull on my 4" light as air shorts from last year. I went back and checked all my metal vent tech tops (SS, LS and sleeveless) and sure enough, all of them that I have ever worn with shorts that have either a zipper pull (as almost every good pair of running shorts does) or venting holes (instead of a venting mesh) is damaged in the same way.

I was skeptical on the pricing, but this has been the best shirt Ive ever owned. Its my favorite shirt to wear to the gym, yoga, cycling and its the only shirt I wear when traveling overseas on a plane.

title: Stains under arm pits
text: I too had an issue with stains under the arm pits. This was only in the blue short and long sleeve Metal Vent shirts. The stains came off after washing the shirts. The next time I wore the shirt with no deodorant there were no stains. I use Gillette Clear Gel deodorant with all of my other Metal Vent shirts and none of them stain. There seems to be some kind of reaction with the blue colored shirts and the deodorant.

title: Uh oh
text: I bought this shirt for my boyfriend a couple weeks ago, and he wore it for the first time yesterday, and he now has big greenish yellow sweatstain spots on his underarms and one the size of my palm on the stomach of the shirt (and he's not an exessive sweater). The shirt he has is a light blue (syra). I have two of these myself (but womens) that I workout in and wear out & about, and I love this shirt and have never had a problem, it was always so breathable. Im really dissappointed because I thought he would be able to work out in this shirt, as he should be able to. Not impressed.
response:
Hey luluaddict16,
There could be a couple of things going on here and in order to speak to your situation powerfully we would love to get a look at this gear. If you have a moment to pop into a store or give us call at the GEC (1.877.263.9300) that would be great. We definitely want to work out a solution with you and get you set up with the right technical top for your sweat sessions. Thanks!

title: fullsleeve top

Sure it is pricey compared to other athletic long sleeved shirts, but no question about it you're paying up for the superior quality. I can't speak to the longevity of it as I've had it for a month or so, but I don't see it going soon.

title: A long sleeve shirt that fits like a workout shirt
text: The metal vent tech LS is a great long sleeve shirt for working out in. What I like most about it is that it actually fits more like a workout shirt than it does like a long sleeve shirt - what I mean by this is that it is quite fitted. I have fairly broad shoulders and a smaller waist, and I find that a lot of long sleeve shirts hang off of me because they are cut too boxy. I would highly recommend this shirt for those cool winter workouts when a short sleeve might not be quite enough.

title: metal & vents

title: The perfect shirt for snowboarding
text: I've worn this guy to the slopes a few times already and it's done a very good job keeping me dry and comfortable in the snow, be it me charging down a trail, riding on powder or a unsuccessful attempt of getting a little "airtime" off a jump. This Metal Tech LS fits almost like a long-sleeve version of a Cardio Tech SS I own, but a touch bigger. I was able to wear this alone under my jacket, but it worked quite well - despite me wearing this as base or only layer it helped keep me warm even on a 15 degree Tahoe day.

title: A little too Long
text: This shirt is one of the most comfortable pieces of clothing I've ever worn. However, It's just too long. I'm a short guy (5'5") with a large muscular build (48"+ chest, 32 waist) so the shirt "fits" very well around the chest and shoulders. The length is just too long though. I'd love it if there was the same option for shirts as there are for some pants, to have a "tall" and "short" option. This would make the top fit better, look better, and move better in workouts.
